text:
we donâ€™t talk about this often - being sick.  we all get sick at one time or another, but itâ€™s one of those topics that is quietly ignored.

yes, we all have tons to do with deadlines.  but there is only one of us.  if we are feeling under the weather, our body is letting us know something is just not right.  instead of ignoring it and pushing through, slow down and listen to what your body needs - rest, liquids, mild foods...and then take care of you and your body.

i am feeling under the weather this weekend.  today i will be resting and watching hallmark christmas movies (i know, theyâ€™re cheesy but i enjoy them!). ğŸ’œ ğŸ“¸: dominik martin
name: Denise Styer, PsyD

text:
since #metoo i have been asked how to support survivors of violence. this is by men and women. those that have experienced abuse and those that haven't.

today we are launching a campaign during the 16 days of activism to support 5 frontline organisations that are working day in and day out to support women that face violence in the uk. if you are able to, please support them by giving whatever you can. they really need help! see link in my bio.

https://www.gofundme.com/rise-together

#16daysofactivism #stopvawg #bame #bme #diversity #violenceagainstwomen #safety #metoo #hearmetoo #metooindia #16daysofactivism2018 #london #ngo #charity #minority #ethnicminority #black #asian #blacklivesmatter #womenforwomen #risetogether
name: Sonal Sachdev Patel

since #metoo i have been asked how to support survivors of violence. this is by men and women. those that have experienced abuse and those that have not.

text:
bannon wanted to use the sorts of aggressive messaging tactics usually reserved for geopolitical conflicts to move the us electorate further to the right, wylie said. he had already directed a series of anti-establishment, conservative documentary films and presided over the far-right website breitbart news, but cambridge analytica would mark another step in his overall ambitions to transform the nation.

with financial backing from hedge-fund billionaire robert mercer, bannon co-founded cambridge analytica in 2013 as the us-branch of strategic communication laboratories (scl) group, a british company that advertises how it has conducted "behavioral change" programs in more than 60 countries.

wylie described cambridge analytica as - steve bannon and robert mercer using a foreign, military contractor ... to use some of the same techniques that the military uses ... on the american electorate.

curt devine, donie o'sullivan and drew griffin
cnn

text:
i've watched the qspiracy since the start.

steve bannon left the wh august last year and q appeared the following october. do you believe in coincidences?

abusing and leaking presidential information to mislead the people and benefit the hijacked party of puppets is obviously just business as usual.

however - while doing this djt with the brave bunch known as gop has willingly opened a pussy wound that anyone around the world can easily contaminate. i like to call it meddlin' with presidental blessin'. i'm not the only one who knows this opportunity and messes with the bombastic patriots - may be russia or china or mbs or antifa or me me me, a tiny quarter pounder sitting on my bed.

the whole qshow seems like a vile roleplay but instead it has become the heart of the propaganda operation that joseph goebbels would have died for. it is obvious that stuff like pizzagateâ„¢ was testing and groundwork for the 2016 election and since it proved to be very effective it is used still, today, right now.

the accompanying memes go way beyond the propaganda of nsdap. social media companies are just helpless with the fake content - there is no way they are going to risk their business by taking a real responsibility.

there is absolutely no way that gop isn't aware of what is going on - after all cambridge analytica worked for ted cruz and john bolton. the whole narrative is built on the same user data that bannon and the mercers reportedly got from cambridge analytica.

and here comes the best part. trumq is truly playing along with his tweets, gestures and words.

the bigger issue still is that requqlicans are willingly piggybacking this lunacy and abusing the faith of their fellow men while campaigning for the midterms. this is not just an insane national security risk - it's a leaking conspiracy and treason in plain sight.

a non

text:
people think they understand, that you are the same. they don't look beyond what they think they know, who wants to lift the curtain and be exposed to the horror waiting there when ignorance is so much easier to live with. 
don't speak, never tell, bite my tongue or go to hell.

#borderlinepersonalitydisorder #bpd #walkingtheborderline #depression #anxiety #ptsd #metoo #youdontknowme

.

text:
hush no more!

published on november 14, 2016 youtube channel ualbertados created this piece to break down the stereotype of what sexual assault really is verse what we think it is.

itâ€™s so important that we share our stories and that we hold our attackers accountable! we tend to blame ourselves! we believe no one will believe us.. knowledge + awareness = prevention!

november 25 international day for the elimination of violence against women. 
an estimated 29.1% of african american females are victimized by intimate partner violence in their lifetime (rape, physical assault or stalking)

african american females experience intimate partner violence at a rate 35% higher than that of white females, and about 2.5 times the rate of women of other races. however, they are less likely than white women to use social services, battered womenâ€™s programs, or go to the hospital because of domestic violence.

according to the national violence against women survey (nvaws), african american women experience higher rates of intimate partner homicide when compared to their white counterparts.

text:
hush no more!

published on november 14, 2016 youtube channel ualbertados created this piece to break down the stereotype of what sexual assault really is verse what we think it is.

itâ€™s so important that we share our stories and that we hold our attackers accountable! we tend to blame ourselves! we believe no one will believe us.. knowledge + awareness = prevention!

text:
have you ever called a narcissist out on his or her behavior? if so, then you know they wonâ€™t tolerate the truth very well at all. brace yourself for one of the coldest, worst and possibly most explosive episodes you've yet to see. 
when i finally figured out the narcissist and told him so (although at the time i did not know what a narcissist was and could not put a name to it) he withdrew. he found a new supply and pursued her and there began the process of a brutal discard, the likes of which i had never experienced.

i had been beaten up twice in my life by two other men at two different times in my life: by my father and later by my not-yet-husband. this discard was worse than either of those two beatings. 
a narcissist discard, after having been brainwashed, is nothing short of hell.

#narcissist #narcissistfree #psychopath #emotionalabuse #healingfromabuse #metoo #nomoreabuse #iamdone #healing #divorce #divoricinganarcissist #doneanddone #breakups #selfesteem #selfdoubt #psychologicalabuse
name: Helping People Heal from Abuse

text:
"ask a man what his greatest fear is about serving jail time, and he will almost inevitably say he fears being raped. what can we deduce from the fact that jail is to men what life is to so many women?"
-
-
from an insult, manipulation, authoritarian treatment to assault, cat calling, femicide, rape... it is all forms of violence. you don't deserve any of this. reach out for help, notice the red flags. don't stay where you are not valued and respected. raise your voice when you don't like something. be whoever you want to be even if society doesn't like itğŸ’ªğŸ¼âœ¨ - international day for the elimination of violence against women.
-
-

text:
hoy, domingo 25 de noviembre es el dÃ­a internacional para la eliminaciÃ³n de la violencia contra la mujer. gran parte de la erradicaciÃ³n de los problemas es la educaciÃ³n, nos unimos a esta lucha y queremos compartir unos datos provistos por las naciones unidas: 
en todo el mundo, una de cada tres mujeres ha sufrido violencia fÃ­sica o sexual, principalmente por parte de un compaÃ±ero sentimental.

solo el 52% de las mujeres casadas o que viven en pareja decide libremente sobre las relaciones sexuales, el uso de anticonceptivos y su salud sexual.

casi 750 millones de mujeres y niÃ±as que viven hoy en dÃ­a se casaron antes de cumplir 18 aÃ±os, mientras que al menos 200 millones de ellas se han visto sometidas a la mutilaciÃ³n genital femenina.

a nivel mundial en 2012, en uno de cada dos casos de mujeres asesinadas, el autor era su compaÃ±ero sentimental o un miembro de su familia. en el caso de los hombres, estas circunstancias Ãºnicamente se dieron en uno de cada 20 hombres asesinados.

el 71% de las vÃ­ctimas de la trata en todo el mundo son mujeres y niÃ±as, y 3 de cada 4 de ellas son utilizadas para la explotaciÃ³n sexual.

la violencia contra la mujer es una causa de muerte e incapacidad entre las mujeres en edad reproductiva tan grave como el cÃ¡ncer y es una causa de mala salud mayor que los accidentes de trÃ¡nsito y la malaria combinados.

puerto rico es parte de estas estadÃ­sticas, nos toca a todos ser parte del cambio. Â¡ni una menos!

text:
non mi vesto di rosso, ma indosso un dettaglio. io che i segni della violenza li porto addosso non ho bisogno di una giornata, ma di rispetto ogni giorno, tutti i giorni.
. 
#25novembregiornatamondialecontrolaviolenzasulledonneâŒğŸš« #25novembre #metoo #violenzasulledonne #quellavoltache #25novembregiornatanondialecontrolaviolenzasulledonne  #nonÃ¨normalechesianormale #
.
ho avuto una relazione con un uomo violento. mi ha usato violenza psicologica e fisica. ho vissuto anni in una spirale fatta di paura, segretezza, io lo cambierÃ², mi ama, Ã¨ colpa mia, non merito altro, ferite e lacrime.
.
quando ne sono uscita, chiedendo aiuto e lottando mentre sentivo la corrente che mi trascinava via, mi sono chiesta come sia stato possibile fosse successo proprio a me. mi reputo una donna intelligente, di cultura, con una famiglia solida alle spalle, eppure non avevo abbastanza stima di me, mi vergognavo a chiedere aiuto.
.
chi ci usa violenza non ci ama. al primo segnale chiediamo aiuto e se non ci credono chiediamolo ancora. salviamoci la vita. facciamolo noi.
.
il sorriso che sfoggio oggi, me lo sono sudato, guadagnato, per ogni sbaffo di rossetto.

text:
today is the international day to end violence against women, organized by @unwomen - as a survivor of gender-based violence and a descendant of a lineage of women who are *all* survivors of gender based violence, i want to remind all female-assigned-at-birth people that we must stand in solidarity with our transgender sisters, who suffer gender based violence worldwide at even higher rates than we do. in the us, transgender women of color are especially vulnerable to hate violence, sexual violence, intimate partner violence, and murder. 82% of transgender people killed this year have been women of color. .
.
.
#hearmetoo #orangetheworld #transgenderwomenarewomen #endrapeculture #endpatriarchy #endtoxicmasculinity #genderbasedviolence #violenceagainstwomen #believesurvivors #metoo #transwomentoo

text:
#16days: â€œmost of the men i know in #southafrica believe that to be masculine they have to be traditional and follow their culture. so, as young girls growing up we knew our work was to do chores at home whilst the boys could go out and play soccer, women and girls must babysit the younger ones whilst men could just sit and relax waiting for their dinner. at grassroot soccer, we teach young people that no one has a certain job to do. girls and boys and men and women are all equal, we can all contribute to household work, and we can all play soccer! we can do things together as a nation to change the harmful gender expectations that exist in our communities." - @asa_rabalao16, @grassrootsoccer #skillzgirl coach
.
#16days #365days #hearmetoo #metoo #orangetheworld #endgbv #endvawg #girlscan

#wethewomen  i was asked what is feminism to you. and even though i had spoken to my friends some thousand times on this, in the past, i got nervous this time. -
-
but i truly believe feminism is a word that has come up now. the feeling was always there. the feeling of the need to be treated equal. thanks to social media now we have a popular word. -
-
my first appearance on my own instagram page. ignore the nervousness, please.
-
-
these are thoughts that rush too often in my head, but i still am camera conscious.
-
-

text:
in recent years, the voices of survivors and activists, through campaigns such as #metoo, #timesup, #niunamenos, #notonemore, #balancetonporc and others, have reached a crescendo that cannot be silenced any more. advocates understand that while the names and contexts may differ across geographic locations, women and girls everywhere are experiencing extensive abuse and their stories need to be brought to light.

this is why the unite campaignâ€™s global advocacy theme this year is: orange the world: #hearmetoo

under the theme orange the world: #hearmetoo, the unite partners are encouraged to host events with local, national, regional and global womenâ€™s movements, survivor advocates and women human rights defenders and create opportunities for dialogue between activists, policy-makers and the public. as in previous years, the colour orange will be a key theme unifying all activities, with buildings and landmarks lit and decorated in orange to bring global attention to the initiative. from 25 november to 10 december, for the 16 days of activism campaign, unite calls for action to orange the world and mobilize resources to end and prevent violence against women.
- (source: un women)

let's be part of this roar of solidarity! follow and join the trend: #50bestpharma #orangetheworld #hearmetoo #16daysofactivism
name: 50Best Pharma

text:
today is the international day to end violence against women, organized by @unwomen - as a survivor of gender-based violence and a descendant of a lineage of women who are *all* survivors of gender based violence, i want to remind all female-assigned-at-birth people that we must stand in solidarity with our transgender sisters, and especially young transgender femmes, who suffer gender based violence worldwide at even higher rates than we do. in the us, transgender femmes are especially vulnerable to hate violence, sexual violence, intimate partner violence, and murder. 64% of transgender people killed this year were under the age of 35.
.
.
.
#hearmetoo #orangetheworld #transgenderwomenarewomen #endrapeculture #endpatriarchy #endtoxicmasculinity #genderbasedviolence #violenceagainstwomen #believesurvivors #metoo #transwomentoo

text:
orange day! it's 'international day for the elimination of violence against women' so wear something orange as we stand against gender based violence! end violence against women and girls.

approximately 15 million adolescent girls (aged 15 to 19) worldwide have experienced forced sex (forced sexual intercourse or other sexual acts) at some point in their life. 
out of these, 9 million adolescent girls were victimized within the past year. in the vast majority of countries, adolescent girls are most at risk of forced sex by a current/former husband, partner or boyfriend. based on data from 30 countries, only one per cent ever sought professional help- un

text:
thereâ€™s a constant continuum of violence against women ranging from just verbal harassment to sexual violation- a rampant reality and as a society we not only ignore it, trivialise it, deny it outright and try to normalise it; but also shame and judge those who try to fight back against it. 
letâ€™s talk about it instead and prosecute it. our future and that of generations of women depends on it.

#orangetheworld #empoweringwomen #womensupportwomen #believesurvivors #metoo #metooindia #internationaldayofviolenceagainstwomen #fightlikeawoman

your abusive partner doesnâ€™t have a problem with his anger; he has a problem with your anger.
"one of the basic human rights he takes away from you is the right to be angry with him. no matter how badly he treats you, he believes that your voice shouldnâ€™t rise and your blood shouldnâ€™t boil. the privilege of rage is reserved for him alone. when your anger does jump out of youâ€”as will happen to any abused woman from time to timeâ€”he is likely to try to jam it back down your throat as quickly as he can. then he uses your anger against you to prove what an irrational person you are. abuse can make you feel straitjacketed. you may develop physical or emotional reactions to swallowing your anger, such as depression, nightmares, emotional numbing, or eating and sleeping problems, which your partner may use as an excuse to belittle you further or make you feel crazy."

text:
today starts the 16 days of activism to say no to violence against women and girls.
more than a third of women worldwide have experienced either physical or sexual violence at some point in their lives. furthermore,Â research indicates that the cost of violence against women could amount annually to around 2 percent of global gross domestic product (gdp). this is equivalent to 1.5 trillion dollars
#hearmetoo is a call to listen to and believe survivors, to end the culture of silencing and to put the survivors at the centre of the response.
it is noted that reducing and preventing violence against women is transformational: it improves the heath of women and children, reduces risks of acquiring hiv and sexually transmitted infections (stis), improves economic productivity and educational attainment, and reduces the risks of mental illness and substance abuse, among other benefits.
â€œto commemorate this yearâ€™s international day for the elimination of violence against women and girls on 25 november, the secretary-generalâ€™s unite campaign is calling upon us to stand in solidarity with survivors and survivor advocates and womenâ€™s human rights defenders who are working to prevent and end violence against women and girls. our duty is not only to stand in solidarity with them but also to intensify our efforts to find solutions and measures to stop this preventable global scourge with a detrimental impact on womenâ€™s and girlsâ€™ lives and health.
@unicef @unfpa @unwomen @unvolunteers @unitednations @undp #thinkmahogany #thinkmahoganycsr 
#hearmetoo #orangetheworld 
#violenceagainstwomen #violenceagainstgirls #unitecampaign #womenshumanrights #metoo 
#internationaldayfortheeliminationofviolenceagainstwomenandgirls #novemberforprosperity

text:
use social media for social good | never lose sight of social good. even as a business. your business can be the biggest voice and lead by example in your community.

we all have a cause and a voice that wants to be heard. although it seems hard to cut through all the 'noise' on social media lately, it's important that we come together as one great big voice to stand for what we believe in as a society. some notable campaigns that brought communities together during a time where we all needed a little more support: #torontostrong #imwithhher #metoo #bellletstalk #marchforourlives #loveislove ..the list could go on.

another perspective is how the toronto police use social media to help keep the streets of toronto safe and connect with the community online: â€œmost people donâ€™t have day to day connections to the police. we use social media to remind the community that weâ€™re people too.â€ - @tpschrisboddy

text:
healing tip: this quote i used as a screen saver on my phone as a subliminal reminder early in my healing path after i left my abuser. by doing so, it helped with rerouting my brain structure creating new neuropathways in my traumatic brain. .
.
try it. give it time to work. i did this for at least 2yrs. it's "like" advertising on the brain concept.
.
with love and appreciation, 
laura 
@laura_healing_with_spirit .

.
.
.
.

text:
non serve a niente una giornata di sensibilizzazione. â™¦ï¸ a niente.
si legge di tutto, ovunque. una battaglia di frasi a effetto a cui fino a ieri nessuno pensava, e che da domani saranno di nuovo dimenticate. 
perchÃ© il contrasto alla violenza non ha bisogno di questo. 
il contrasto alla violenza richiede un lavorio continuo, costante, incessante: l'esempio, gli insegnamenti, le letture, le regole, ogni santo giorno, esercitato sui figli di ogni etÃ . 
il contrasto alla violenza fallisce quando difendiamo nostro figlio a spada tratta da ogni accusa prima di chiederci se sia davvero infondata.
fallisce ogni volta in cui sfiduciamo il lavoro di un'insegnante, o di altro tipo di educatore, o quando critichiamo i suoi compagni; insomma.. quando facciamo sentire lui e solo lui al di sopra di tutto.
fallisce quando non sappiamo trasmettere ai nostri ragazzi l'importanza di certi valori, delle autoritÃ , del rispetto incondizionato verso il prossimo. sÃ¬, il rispetto. incondizionato.
fallisce quando gli permettiamo tutto e sempre, privandolo del sano no, dell'esercizio alla accettazione della sconfitta e del diniego. 
la violenza che cresce testimonia unicamente che l'asse 'culturale' si sta spostando, e a spostarlo siamo solo noi, nella nostra incapacitÃ  di metterci in discussione come educatori, rischiando seriamente di tirar su uomini che domani non avranno rispetto per l'altro e che, anzichÃ© accettare un rifiuto, preferiranno cancellare l'ombra della donna che glielo avrÃ  opposto.
non servono i post di cui state inondando le bacheche, nÃ© immagini forti, che faranno effetto solo a chi Ã¨ giÃ  sensibile al problema, ma non a tutti gli altri. 
tutto questo serve unicamente a mettere a posto la coscienza e a dirvi "ho contributo alla causa". invece, lasciatevelo dire, se non farete anche tutto il resto non avrete contributo proprio a niente.
oggi abbiamo dei ragazzi, uomo o donna che siano. domani potrebbero essere vittima e carnefice. chiediamoci subito cosa potremmo fare per evitarlo. chiediamocelo davvero. e facciamolo.

text: di hari pertama dimulainya 16 hari anti kekerasan terhadap perempuan, saya memakai celana ini saat sedang liburan. saat sedang makan siang partner saya berkata, "nih ya ada laki, gue tunjuk aja karena dia vulgar banget ngeliatin pantat kamu. tuh dia yang pakai baju hitam." bukan cuma lelaki itu, ada beberapa mata yang melakukan hal sama. saya berada dalam konteks liburan di daerah tepi pantai, apakah dengan memakai celana seperti ini berarti saya bebas dilihat dengan pandangan predator? hari ini hingga 10 desember 2018, kita akan melaksanakan #16daysofactivism atau #16haktp. 1 dari 3 perempuan di indonesia pernah mengalami kekerasan. proporsi yang sama juga terjadi pada perempuan di seluruh dunia menurut @unwomen. ada banyak cara berpartisipasi dalam acara ini. belajar tentang ruu pencegahan kekerasan seksual di @indonesiafeminis. isi survey pelecehan seksual di ruang publik dari @hollaback_jkt. buat yang sudah bekerja pernahkah mengalami pelecehan seksual? suarakan pendapatmu tentang topik ini di survey @neverokayproject. bangkit dan lawan pelecehan seksual. bercerita adalah bagian dari resistensi ğŸ‘ŠğŸ¾ #hearmetoo #metoo

text:
today marks the international day for the elimination of violence against women. .
.
gender-based violence manifests itself physically, sexually and psychologically. alarming statistics provided by @unwomen @unwomenla  that we must fix:
.
.
.
1 in 3 women and girls experience physical or sexual violence in their lifetime, most frequently by an intimate partner
.
only 52% of women married or in a union freely make their own decisions about sexual relations, contraceptive use and health care
.
worldwide, almost 750 million women and girls alive today were married before their 18th birthday; while 200 million women and girls have undergone female genital mutilation (fgm)
.
.
1 in 2 women killed worldwide were killed by their partners or family in 2012; while only 1 out of 20 men were killed under similar circumstances
.
.
71% of all human trafficking victims worldwide are women and girls, and 3 out of 4 of these women and girls are sexually exploited.
.
.
#hearmetoo #believesurvivors #orangetheworld #metoo #timesup #balancetonporc #niunamenos #metooindia #hollaback! #endviolence #violenceagainstwomen #stoptheviolence #domesticviolence #globalhealth #intimatepartnerviolence #genderbasedviolence #endtheviolence #stopviolence #globalcitizen #changetheworld #metoomovement #humanrights #humanrightscampaign #internationalwomensday #internationaldayofthegirl #humantrafficking #childmarriage #femalegenitalmutilation #violenceagaisntwomen #violenceagainstchildren

text:
part 2

i dance to let go of my pain.
i dance to express what
my mouth don't say sometimes.
i dance because it frees my soul
in ways that only music have the power to do.
i dance because it cures all my wounds
and it makes me feel alive!
and i just love to danceâ¤ï¸

this nusic is so powerful,but it tells not a beautiful history,it shows the reality of many that didn't choose what happened with them,but yet have to live with that pain,that wound in their soul,menories that will never go away,and the ignorance of people that don't know what they talking about,and some times blame the victims for the cruelty they lived and think that is easy to tell them that'' it happened so long ago,u should just let go,forget it...''
let's have more love and compassion for one another because love is thegreatest thing we can give each other!

giornata internazionale contro la violenza sulle donne "borgo flora, 5 novembre 1981 
devi sapere che nel primo anno di matrimonio la delusione Ã¨ stata cocente sul fatto che un marito puÃ² anche non essere capace di essere amico della moglie, quindi quanto spesso sono stata sola in casa mi sentivo scoppiare dalla solitudine e prendevo penna e quaderno per scrivere la mia tristezza, ma dopo alcuni anni l'ho rivisto e l'ho bruciato perchÃ© era incomprensibile pensa che erano 10 anni che non scrivevo piÃ¹ se vedessi la mia pagella della quinta elementare ti spaventeresti. 
ora perÃ² stando vicino ai mie figli per aiutarli a scuola, e leggendo spesso perchÃ© mi piace la storia e l'informazione, geografia e scienze anche un pÃ² i romanzi e la politica, sÃ² di essere all'alteza della mia misera cultura e poi ho deciso di accettarmi come sono compresa l'ignoranza quindi hÃ² messo nella facciata la mia foto con tutti i miei dati per sconfiggere ogni tentazione di bruciarti, perchÃ© mi guarderÃ² e capirÃ² che tu quaderno sei la vera luisa nel bene e nel male e rinnegarti sarebbe un suicidio."

text:
as global mobilizations soar, un women brings survivors of #violence and advocates to centre stage on international day for the elimination of violence against #women and #girls
this yearâ€™s un theme, â€œorange the world: #hearmetooâ€ will amplify voices, bringing many more actions and solutions forward during â€œ#16daysofactivism against gender-based violenceâ€

global movements such as #metoo, #timesup, #balancetonporc, #niunamenos, #hollaback! and #totalshutdown and corporate walk-outs in recent times have exposed the magnitude of violence against women and girls and how often it is normalized. while research shows that violence against women and girls affects one in three women worldwide and that no country is immune to this pandemic, instead of holding perpetrators accountable, women and girls who experience violence are often blamed and their testimonies systematically put in doubt. "not until the half of our population represented by women and girls can live free of fear, violence and everyday insecurity, can we truly say we live in a fair and equal world" says un secretary-general, antÃ³nio guterres. "it is our collective responsibility that the world is a better and safer place for women and girls" says executive director of #unwomen, phumzile mlambo-ngcuka

additional information from #unic at https://bit.ly/2s9440p or caribbeanun.org

text:
25 de noviembre: dÃ­a internacional de la eliminaciÃ³n de la violencia contra la mujer.
a diferencia del aÃ±o pasado, hoy no tengo una historia tan especifica por contar, pero en este aÃ±o he sido vÃ­ctima de violencia varÃ­as veces y estoy segura que muchas de mis amigas tambiÃ©n. me he sentido insegura por ponerme un vestido hasta el punto de no querer usar transporte pÃºblico, me han pegado en la cola solo por que si, me han dicho â€œdeja de ser tan nenaâ€, y obviamente no faltan los piropos asquerosos por la calle. formas de violencia que estÃ¡n tan normalizadas que cuando he reclamado por ellas solo he recibido respuestas como â€œay, Â¿te vas a poner brava por eso?â€ o simplemente, â€œpues no te vistas asÃ­ y yaâ€ 
es que realmente me parece desastroso que sigan pasando los aÃ±os y los dÃ­as y que muy pocas cosas cambien, que tengamos que tener un dÃ­a en contra de la violencia de gÃ©nero Â¡Â¿quÃ©?! es que somos humanos tambiÃ©n, Â¿no se dan cuenta? no deberÃ­a existir tal cosa, pero sin embargo aquÃ­ estamos, en las calles, en las universidades, en los colegios, en los trabajos y en las casas, asÃ­ sea por este medio exigiendo que esto cambie. 
este semestre realice un proyecto con respecto a esto y viendo los Ã­ndices de violencia de este paÃ­s cada vez mÃ¡s vamos en decadencia. no se que mas escribir por quÃ© la soluciÃ³n a esto es tan intangible, es un cambio de chip en la cabeza que nadie lo puede hacer por nadie.

text:
today is the international day for the elimination of violence against women.
these causes sound really general when you donâ€™t personalize them. so let me share with you something personal:
i have been the victim of physical and psychological violence within more than one intimate relationship in the past. i take responsibility for putting myself in that situation. many women in the world donâ€™t have a choice. i did. but i wish the people in my environment had helped me understand i deserved more.
it is our duty to empower and support all the women we can reach. i urge all sons, daughters, brothers, sisters, fathers, mothers and friends to join me in this long path towards eliminating violence towards women.
and to those who think we are in a good place, words of the united nations:
â€œviolence against women continues to be an obstacle to achieving equality, development, peace as well as to the fulfillment of women and girlsâ€™ human rights. all in all, the promise of the sustainable development goals (sdgs) - to leave no one behind - cannot be fulfilled without putting an end to violence against women and girls.
alarming figures
* 1 in 3 women and girls experience physical or sexual violence in their lifetime, most frequently by an intimate partner
* only 52% of women married or in a union freely make their own decisions about sexual relations, contraceptive use and health care
* worldwide, almost 750 million women and girls alive today were married before their 18th birthday; while 200 million women and girls have undergone female genital mutilation (fgm)
* 1 in 2 women killed worldwide were killed by their partners or family in 2012; while only 1 out of 20 men were killed under similar circumstances
* 71% of all human trafficking victims worldwide are women and girls, and 3 out of 4 of these women and girls are sexually exploited
* violence against women is as serious a cause of death and incapacity among women of reproductive age as cancer, and a greater cause of ill health than traffic accidents and malaria combinedâ€
please take action. every little gesture counts. changing the world is in our hands âœŠ
â€¢
spanish in comments.

text:
fragile, opulenta donna, matrice del paradiso
sei un granello di colpa
anche agli occhi di dio
malgrado le tue sante guerre
per lâ€™emancipazione.
spaccarono la tua bellezza
e rimane uno scheletro dâ€™amore
che perÃ² grida ancora vendetta
e soltanto tu riesci
ancora a piangere,
poi ti volgi e vedi ancora i tuoi figli,
poi ti volti e non sai ancora dire
e taci meravigliata
e allora diventi grande come la terra
e innalzi il tuo canto dâ€™amore.
(a tutte le donne, alda merini)

text:
5 years ago it felt like my life had imploded... for the first time in almost 40 years, i said these words out loud: â€œiâ€™m a survivor of childhood sexual abuse.â€ with nowhere to turn and feeling desperate for help, i wrote those same words on a facebook post hoping someone would have an answer about how to move forward and heal. 
a few minutes later, i got a private message from someone who i had gone to elementary school with, someone who iâ€™d only recently reconnected with via facebook. in her message she told me: â€œitâ€™s going to be really difficult for a while, but it will get better. i promise.â€ she also told me about a place called @thegatehousetoronto where i could get some trauma support. 
i would not be standing here today were it not for the love and support of this incredible woman who reached in and lifted me up. you never know the impact of your words... letâ€™s be there for one another. 
#sexualviolence #rape #survivor #metoo #speakup #timesup #love #support #relentlesslyforward #jpsteam

text:
recently, 4 tanzanian women and 2 nigerian men locked themselves up when a hostile mob following some rumours about them practicing 'cannibalism' and 'kidnapping children' gathered outside their house in hari nagar, dwarka. 
the women are really scared. their families are  trying to convince them to stay but they reportedly don't want to continue living in india. 
we complain of intolerance when we're abroad but what are we doing? we preach of being a very inclusive nation but is it true? are we practicing what we preach?

#changingmindsets

text:
â€œsometimes men at my work say things like, â€˜look at that white skin, why do you look so tempting?â€™ when i report them, managers tell me that my co-workers are just being friendly. managers donâ€™t understand sexual harassment, they say, â€˜donâ€™t take it seriously! they are just kidding with you.â€™ i have a 3-year-old daughter. based on my experience, i can't predict what's going to happen to her. even when she is an adult, iâ€™ll still worry about her. it's hard to let her go. thereâ€™s no way for me to know if someone might harass her.â€ â€” arunny, in cambodia

today, the international day for the elimination of violence against women, we join the global movement for #16days of activism against gender-based violence. more than one-third of the world's countries do not have any laws prohibiting sexual harassment at work â€“ leaving nearly 235 million working women vulnerable in the workplace. yet there is no international legal standard specifically for protecting women at work from these abuses. you can help make workplaces safe for women everywhere - click the link in bio to learn more and sign the petition. #thisisnotworking #16days #hearmetoo #metoo ğŸ“·simon duncan-watt/care

text:
in questa giornata contro la violenza sulle donne, che come sapete mi sta molto a cuore, vi propongo una lista di gesti quotidiani che le donne fanno di cui gli uomini non dovranno preoccuparsi mai, nella speranza che aiuti tutti a capire meglio cosa vuol dire essere una donna, e che meccanismi dobbiamo attuare per proteggerci. tutte. - tenere le chiavi in mano da usare come arma quando camminiamo per strada da sole di notte â€“ a volte anche di giorno
- spegnere le cuffie per cercare di capire se siamo seguite per strada â€“ personalmente a volte faccio lâ€™opposto, metto su lâ€™arena di ennio morricone, o la settima sinfonia di beethoven per entrare in stato di guerra
- chiamare gli amici quando siamo sul taxi/uber per sentirci al sicuro
- mandare messaggi agli amici quando arriviamo a casa per far sapere loro che siamo al sicuro â€“ purtroppo lo dimentico 9 volte su 10, perciÃ² chiedo scusa a tutti i miei amici che non hanno mai ricevuto quel messaggio <3
- sederci vicino ad unâ€™altra donna sui mezzi pubblici per minimizzare di essere attaccate - evitare addirittura di uscire di casa se Ã¨ troppo presto al mattino/troppo tardi la sera perchÃ© non sembra sicuro
- fingere di essere al telefono in moltissimi casi per evitare ogni tipo di molestia
- dare agli uomini nomi e numeri di telefono falsi piuttosto che rischiare di farli arrabbiare per essere stati rifiutati
- indossare un anello sullâ€™anulare sinistro per ridurre le chances di flirt indesirati da parte degli uomini, perchÃ© rispettano la â€œproprietÃ â€ di un altro uomo piÃ¹ del diritto di una donna di dire â€œnoâ€
- stare in silenzio quando veniamo verbalmente molestate, per il terrore che diventerÃ  violento se rispondiamo a tono
- farci il mazzo tanto a lavoro nonostante sappiamo di essere pagate meno degli  uomini nella stessa posizione

text:
we are not alone in our tragedies. as i worked on these pieces for three and a half years, there were so many shards of pain and new memories evolving into joy, i realized the title had changed in my heart from â€œreflections of a broken childâ€ to
â€œwindows to my soul.â€
i am no longer broken; i had released my tortured pain and in the process i found myself. i have had a magnificent life after healing.

i hope others will be able to see, that once you are able to live free of fear, shame and misplaced guilt, your life shifts profoundly and you can embrace your soul wholly. we must all heal each other and thus our world.
.
.
.
. #uniqueart #artist #fineart #sculpture #trauma  #childabuse #mixedmediacollage #spiritualart  #birthingyourself #ptsd #molestation #anger  #peace #innerpeace #emotionalart #healingart  #abuse #narcissism #powerfulart  #amputee #jewishart #lifestory #dorijalazo  #windowstomysoul #believesurvivors #metoo #believechildren #installationart #lovehannahgadsby #speakyourtruth

pre_proc_tweet:
we are not alone in our tragedies. as i worked on these pieces for three and a half years, there were so many shards of pain and new memories evolving into joy, i realized the title had changed in my hea from â€œreflections of a broken childâ€ to
â€œwindows to my soul.â€
i am no longer broken; i had released my toured pain and in the process i found myself. i have had a magnificent life after healing.

i hope others will be able to see, that once you are able to live free of fear, shame and misplaced guilt, your life shifts profoundly and you can embrace your soul wholly. we must all heal each other and thus our world.
.
.
.
.

text:
poesia contro il femminicidio.
- bestie e fiori -
quel rumor del piatto 
deposto sul piano agiato,
come le colazioni di ventâ€™anni or sono.
medesimo colpo alto e cavo,
nel silenzio rassegnato al vile disprezzo.
dimenticare lâ€™acqua fangosa 
a scorrere dal rubinetto,
quando le braccia tanto esili quanto servili, 
al fine olfatto,
sono solo fragili ossi per una bestia ringhiosa.
una cena fredda poichÃ© consumata con lentezza 
ha immensa colpa,
e guadagna del buon vino negli occhi,
il bruciore, la costrizione 
di leccarsi le labbra.
stride la sedia 
trascinata allâ€™indietro,
lâ€™aria si sposta allâ€™impeto e le narici
si fanno calde e dilatate
e la bocca piega al suolo.
non voglio cedere
per riordinare il volto
e riaprire le palpebre
a colui che calcia le gambe.
sto forse morendo
come un animale del circo,
per opera di un essere umano?
morire, 
con addosso il vestito da lui scelto,
fetido di terrore ed aciditÃ .
morire, 
Ã¨ la prima volta 
o forse la seconda.
imploro che sciolga il nodo soffocante
e nel singhiozzare alla vita di domani,
rivedo ogni porta che Ã¨ stata creata 
e la benevolenza 
che rende umilmente vivi.
rimembro, nel poco tempo, 
la cena calda,
lâ€™acqua limpida dal rubinetto,
gli infiniti abbracci 
su questo collo,
da quando nacqui fino a questa sera
in questo vestito di fiori.
â€¢
â€¢ -g.r.-â€¢mypoem38â€¢

text:
(delhi, india)
â€œit happened for the first time when i was 12. i lived in patna with my family â€“ my uncle would visit us during summer break. he was 10 years older than me. it started subtly, with â€˜harmlessâ€™ touches. i was a child â€“ i couldnâ€™t even make sense of it, but i knew it was wrong. 
i decided to confide in my mom. i even wrote her a letter, hoping that things would change. but later, i found that letter in the dustbin. my uncle had gotten rid of it. he began to brainwash me into believing that this was how things were between a girl & a boy â€“ that it was â€˜rightâ€™. we moved to delhi when i was in 8th grade & he began living with us. he got the chance to move beyond the usual touching. when i would be in bed, heâ€™d cuddle me & touch my private parts. he kept manipulating me â€“ iâ€™d plead for him to stop, but he never did. 
years later, i decided to study at a college that was far away â€“ i finally had a reprieve from the pain. there, i saw couples & realized that the â€˜relationshipâ€™ i was forced into wasnâ€™t natural. i didnâ€™t know what to do & my mind began to go back to these dreadful memories. soon, my mental health degraded. 
i decided to meet a psychologist & for once, let it all out. she helped me come to terms with the fact that i was sexually abused as a child. she made me realize that it wasnâ€™t my fault & i shouldnâ€™t blame myself. she gave me the courage to face my abuser.
a year ago, i tried to make him understand that what he did was wrong. heâ€™d gotten engaged by then & instead of repenting for his mistakes, he told me that it would all end if we could do it one last time before he got married. i gave up then â€“ there was just no point to it all. 
i told my mom everything recently â€“ i didnâ€™t take any names though, because i knew it would change the family dynamic. but she said that she knew who it was â€“ she noticed me being uncomfortable around him. she thought that sheâ€™d failed as a mother. 
my confession broke her, but it released me. a weight was lifted off my chest, and day by day, itâ€™s getting easier to breathe. my grief hasnâ€™t lessened â€“ i donâ€™t know if it ever will. but for now, this much is enough. for now, being able to talk about, is enough.â€
name: We, The People

text:
- bannon got it immediately. he believes in the whole andrew breitbart doctrine that politics is downstream from culture, so to change politics you need to change culture. and fashion trends are a useful proxy for that. trump is like a pair of uggs, or crocs, basically. so how do you get from people thinking â€˜ugh. totally uglyâ€™ to the moment when everyone is wearing them? that was the inflection point he was looking for.

is what cambridge analytica does akin to bullying? - i think itâ€™s worse than bullying, christopher wylie says. - because people donâ€™t necessarily know itâ€™s being done to them. at least bullying respects the agency of people because they know. so itâ€™s worse, because if you do not respect the agency of people, anything that youâ€™re doing after that point is not conducive to a democracy. and fundamentally, information warfare is not conducive to democracy.

millions of peopleâ€™s personal information was stolen and used to target them in ways they wouldnâ€™t have seen, and couldnâ€™t have known about, by a mercenary outfit, cambridge analytica, who, wylie says, â€œwould work for anyoneâ€. who would pitch to russian oil companies. would they subvert elections abroad on behalf of foreign governments?

it occurs to me to ask wylie this one night. - yes.

nato or non-nato? - either. i mean theyâ€™re mercenaries. theyâ€™ll work for pretty much anyone who pays.

itâ€™s an incredible revelation. it also encapsulates all of the problems of outsourcing â€“ at a global scale, with added cyberweapons. and in the middle of it all are the public â€“ our intimate family connections, our â€œlikesâ€, our crumbs of personal data, all sucked into a swirling black hole thatâ€™s expanding and growing and is now owned by a politically motivated billionaire.

carole cadwalladr
the guardian

text: #donttellmehowtodress is now in manila and part of a national campaign #respetonaman to end sexual assault and violence against women. iâ€™m so humbled and proud of have my campaign be a part of this movement to push back against rape culture and victim blaming in both our countries of thailand and the philippines and across the region. the time is now to stand up for our women and girls and let them know that we hear them, we believe them and we stand with them to fight for their rights to be safe from all kinds of violence. join us and pls visit @donttellmehowtodress exhibit on now at power plant mall until dec 1. thank you from the bottom of my heart for joining in this conversation and for your support. #metoo #16days #unite #timesup @donttellmehowtodress @sparkphilippines

text:
- bannon got it immediately. he believes in the whole andrew breitbart doctrine that politics is downstream from culture, so to change politics you need to change culture. and fashion trends are a useful proxy for that. trump is like a pair of uggs, or crocs, basically. so how do you get from people thinking â€˜ugh. totally uglyâ€™ to the moment when everyone is wearing them? that was the inflection point he was looking for.

is what cambridge analytica does akin to bullying? - i think itâ€™s worse than bullying, christopher wylie says. - because people donâ€™t necessarily know itâ€™s being done to them. at least bullying respects the agency of people because they know. so itâ€™s worse, because if you do not respect the agency of people, anything that youâ€™re doing after that point is not conducive to a democracy. and fundamentally, information warfare is not conducive to democracy.

millions of peopleâ€™s personal information was stolen and used to target them in ways they wouldnâ€™t have seen, and couldnâ€™t have known about, by a mercenary outfit, cambridge analytica, who, wylie says, â€œwould work for anyoneâ€. who would pitch to russian oil companies. would they subvert elections abroad on behalf of foreign governments?

it occurs to me to ask wylie this one night. - yes.

nato or non-nato? - either. i mean theyâ€™re mercenaries. theyâ€™ll work for pretty much anyone who pays.

itâ€™s an incredible revelation. it also encapsulates all of the problems of outsourcing â€“ at a global scale, with added cyberweapons. and in the middle of it all are the public â€“ our intimate family connections, our â€œlikesâ€, our crumbs of personal data, all sucked into a swirling black hole thatâ€™s expanding and growing and is now owned by a politically motivated billionaire.

carole cadwalladr
the guardian

text:
there are so many types of violence... when he says youâ€™re stupid, you should go by a psychologist itâ€™s violence... when every month he says he doesnâ€™t have money for the rent or for the bills and let you pay everything every single month ... thatâ€™s violence 
when he says you cannot go to visit your family, meet your best friend, have a cup of coffee with a colleague thatâ€™s violence 
when you are not with him and he constantly is texting you saying you have responded too late, you should call him instead of talking to other persons and go back home immediately this is violence 
iâ€™m strong, fierce, free and ambitious again no more cages for me, no more asking for permission for everything 
i am me!

text: dear followers, please take a moment while i explain why iâ€™ve been absent here lately (the many words in this post are necessary to make myself perfectly clear). in my daily life iâ€™ve been adjusting my course. in short that means that iâ€™m in the process of putting myself and my artistic work â€˜in world serviceâ€™. what does that mean? originally iâ€™m a dutch poet and i write about the emotions of life. with my poems and photographs i tell my life story. at this point iâ€™m writing a book and iâ€™m transforming my photographs into products to sell. my mission is to generate a cash flow with my work. the full proceeds that will come from selling my work will be donated to charities of my choice that are related to my life story. besides donating money iâ€™ll be donating my time and energy as well by being personally involved. what is my life story about and why? as a child i was sexually abused which caused a lot of damage to myself and the people around me. for many years i travelled through the darkness and experienced a lot of negativity. luckily those days are long over now because iâ€™ve been able to find the strength within me and managed to find my way into the light. now the time has come that iâ€™m ready to share my story and start helping those in need. financial self-enrichment that comes from my own misery is not how itâ€™s meant to be, that doesnâ€™t feel right. reaching out to others and making a positive difference in their lives does feel right. and so it will be. so today i change my course here on instagram. what can you expect from me here as of today? iâ€™ll start posting and communicating differently by sharing the journey iâ€™m on. sometimes in english and sometimes in dutch, depending on the post. and donâ€™t worry, my posts will still be uplifting like youâ€™re used to, i just add meaning. of course you can still expect me to share beautiful photos. i hope you stick around but if not, no hard feelings. i wish each and every one of you nothing but the best and wanna thank you for the amazing support youâ€™ve given me so far, much appreciated! â¤ï¸ wishing you a lovely sunday ğŸ’«ğŸ™ ps. next posts will definitely be a lot shorter ğŸ™ƒğŸ˜…

as a child i was sexually abused which caused a lot of damage to myself and the people around me. for many years i travelled through the darkness and experienced a lot of negativity. luckily those days are long over now because iâ€™ve been able to find the strength within me and managed to find my way into the light. now the time has come that iâ€™m ready to share my story and sta helping those in need. ficial self-enrichment that comes from my own misery is not how itâ€™s meant to be, that doesnâ€™t feel right. reaching out to others and making a positive difference in their lives does feel right. and so it will be. so today i change my course here on instagram. what can you expect from me here as of today? iâ€™ll sta posting and communicating differently by sharing the journey iâ€™m on. sometimes in english and sometimes in dutch, depending on the post. and donâ€™t worry, my posts will still be uplifting like youâ€™re used to, i just add meaning. of course you can still expect me to share beautiful photos. i hope you stick around but if not, no hard feelings. i wish each and every one of you nothing but the best and wanna thank you for the amazing suppo youâ€™ve given me so far, much appreciated! â¤ï¸ wishing you a lovely sunday ğŸ’«ğŸ™ ps. next posts will definitely be a lot shoer ğŸ™ƒğŸ˜…

text:
la violenza di genere ha tante forme: psicologica, economica, lavorativa, sociale.
.
la violenza fisica Ã¨ spesso la piÃ¹ visibile, ma le altre forme non sono meno pericolose, soprattutto quando vengono perpetrate da parenti, amici, colleghi di lavoro, dalla societÃ  tutta
.
in questo paese, dove a ogni passo avanti ne facciamo due indietro, dove ogni volta che conquistiamo un diritto dobbiamo scendere in piazza per vederlo applicato, dove la paritÃ  Ã¨ sÃ¬ a portata di mano, ma inafferrabile, come acqua tra le dita, serve un cambiamento profondo, culturale
.
allora entriamo a far parte di questo cambiamento: educhiamo gli uomini e le donne di domani al rispetto, gettiamo ogni giorno un seme di comprensione contro gli stereotipi.
.
non ridiamo delle battute sessiste, non denigriamo le donne per le loro abitudini sessuali, non minimizziamo l'esperienza di chi ha subito una violenza o un sopruso, non voltiamoci dall'altra parte quando una ragazza viene molestata per strada o sui mezzi pubblici. .
e voi uomini, alleati, compagni: praticate l'empatia, l'ascolto e la comprensione, liberatevi da quelli stessi stereotipi che vi vogliono piÃ¹ simili agli animali che a esseri senzienti e dotati di intelletto quali siete
.
solo cosÃ¬, con piccole azioni di resistenza quotidiana, cambieremo questa cultura malata che divide il mondo a metÃ  e fa male a tutti, uomini inclusi.
.
.
.

text:
bannon wanted to use the sorts of aggressive messaging tactics usually reserved for geopolitical conflicts to move the us electorate further to the right, wylie said. he had already directed a series of anti-establishment, conservative documentary films and presided over the far-right website breitbart news, but cambridge analytica would mark another step in his overall ambitions to transform the nation.

with financial backing from hedge-fund billionaire robert mercer, bannon co-founded cambridge analytica in 2013 as the us-branch of strategic communication laboratories (scl) group, a british company that advertises how it has conducted "behavioral change" programs in more than 60 countries.

wylie described cambridge analytica as - steve bannon and robert mercer using a foreign, military contractor ... to use some of the same techniques that the military uses ... on the american electorate.

curt devine, donie o'sullivan and drew griffin
cnn

text:
a question for my followers: what are you doing to combat violence against women and girls?
â€¢
today is international day for the elimination of violence against women, as declared by the @unitednations. violence against women and girls remains a serious issue, within and beyond us borders. to give you a global perspective, "violence against women is as serious a cause of death and incapacity among women of reproductive age as cancer, and a greater cause of ill health than traffic accidents and malaria combined . . . 1 in 2 women killed worldwide were killed by their partners or family in 2012; while only 1 out of 20 men were killed under similar circumstances . . . 1 in 3 women and girls experience physical or sexual violence in their lifetime, most frequently by an intimate partner" (@unitednationshumanrights).
â€¢
oftentimes i think of my experience with intimate partner violence as an isolated, deeply personal issue, but truly, my experience is part of a larger collective of gender-based violence.

text:
join our feminist tour to visit the stunning national archives and learn all about the history of black women's fight against slavery in chile ğŸ’ªğŸ½
during the colonial era the population of santiago was up to 25% black slaves, most of them women. at the national archives are stored hundreds of these women's petitions for liberty, where they decried their mistreatment and abuse. thanks to their push, chile was the first country in latin america to ban all forms of slavery in 1823.
we owe these women so much! visit this incredible site to honor them.

#travelchile #feminism #metoo #santiago

text:
so, this is me, lorraine. i had been holding back in creating my first online course - but the calling is becoming louder and louder...
six years ago, life was great i was working for a swiss investment bank in the heart of the city of london, i had been working in wealth management for over 10 years, wealth management is basically helping the 1%, the rich get richer. nothing wrong with that and i am grateful for my career but i wanted to have a life with more meaning. it was an august afternoon in 2012, life was good and  i was feeling blessed ğŸ˜‡ . i got down on my knees and said a prayer of gratitude straight from my heart and asked god to show me how to do his work. the very same day, i was drugged and â€˜taken advantage ofâ€™ by a work colleague (#metoo) ğŸ˜and it sent my life into disarray. i experienced very dark times with depression, ptsd, anxiety - the works.  during this time, even though i couldn't understand why i went through the incident that i did, i kept my eyes ğŸ‘€ on god and miraculous things started to happen. from supernatural experiences, to the manifestation of much needed money ğŸ’µ within seconds of praying about it, to the prayer ğŸ™ğŸ½ i said before going to sleep one night that saw me wake up to the stock (from my side hustle) that had been sitting around for 5 years suddenly get bought by an #abc us sitcom to be a part of their set!
i will share with you things that i have learnt from other spiritual leaders, resilience teachers and world leading meditation teachers. 
i know that what i have been through cannot be in vain and i want to share what i can and empower and encourage who i can. â€¢
â€¢
â€¢

i am therefore launching a 6 week live online course. â€¢
â€¢

#rebalanceandrevive: â€œmaster the power within,
 to overcome life's obstacles, so you can upgrade your future and thrive in all that you do in 6 weeksâ€™â€™ â€¢
â€¢
â€¢

as the course is live, spaces will be limited. it will be an environment that encourages peer support, and psychologically as helpful as any therapy. 
please send me a dm if you would like further information â€¢

letâ€™s see if we can rebalance & revive your life too. ğŸ‰ğŸ™ŒğŸ½ğŸ’•ğŸ™ğŸ½

in this episode of let's talk, we catch up on the behind the scenes with the pataki,founder of @designpataki ms.esha gupta. speaking about her obsession with art,  design and architecture,  esha speaks about how it all started with a blog which is now an audience favorite magazine. from speaking about the appalling extent of the #metoo to taking inspiration from social media and traveling,  esha dreams of starting an ngo some day. 
but the most important part,  she's left us all views with an intriguing question, "which rooms don't have corners"? think about it and give your answers in the comment section below!

text:
today november 25th is the unâ€™s international day for the elimination of violence against women.
â€œnot until the half of our population represented by women and girls can live free from fear, violence and everyday insecurity, can we truly say we live in a fair and equal world." â€” un secretary-general antÃ³nio guterres

many of you may have experienced violence or know of friend who has. the stats are grim:

1 in 3 women and girls experience physical or sexual violence in their lifetime, most frequently by an intimate partner

only 52% of women married or in a union freely make their own decisions about sexual relations, contraceptive use and health care

worldwide, almost 750 million women and girls alive today were married before their 18th birthday; while 200 million women and girls have undergone female genital mutilation (fgm)

1 in 2 women killed worldwide were killed by their partners or family in 2012; while only 1 out of 20 men were killed under similar circumstances

71% of all human trafficking victims worldwide are women and girls, and 3 out of 4 of these women and girls are sexually exploited

violence against women is as serious a cause of death and incapacity among women of reproductive age as cancer, and a greater cause of ill health than traffic accidents and malaria combined. 
#orangeurworld, #orangetheworld, #hearmetoo, #endvaw #16daysofactivism #metoo #ahimsa #sayhername #drdorothyhalton #drelenafric #drtamaraoâ€™neal

text:
today is international day for the elimination of violence against women. we see a lot of talk and many a campaign against violence on women. #intersectionalfeminism is the new in-thing, and somehow, their sections end at a species level. they happily advocate the rape of cows, chickens, dogs and cats as they sip their starbucks coffee and take a bite of their fillet mignon, with their persian cats purring on their laps. you're not an intersectional #feminist if you're not #vegan
.
ğŸ®ğŸ a cow produces milk and babies only when impregnated. and see the pictures to see how impregnation is done. if that isn't rape, what is it? all the male calves that can't produce milk? beef. same with goats and mutton.
.
ğŸ¶ğŸ± the cute purebred puppy or kitten that you want, comes from the rape of strapped and tied up dogs and cats as you see in two pictures.
.
ğŸ”ğŸ£ your chicken and eggs are also product of rape. how else do you think thousands of chicken at a farm are impregnated?
.
ğŸğŸƒ wool and leather? more animals required means more birthed means more raped.
.
ğŸ· that fashionable bacon? from pigs who spend their lives in a tiny 4'x2' pens from one impregnation to next, birth to death.
.
today is also #worldvegetarianday. but as you see above, being vegetarian isn't enough. animal farming is the number of contributor to deforestation and global warming. so, #govegan for the animals, for your health and for the planet.
.
#veganism #meatismurder

text:
ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹ buongiorno dal giardino di castello! nella giornata  internazionale contro la violenza sulle donne oggi ricordiamo anche le grandi figure femminili della famiglia medici, alcune delle quali ebbero a che fare con la nostra meravigliosa villa. caterina sforza, maria salviati, eleonora di toledo, maria luisa de medici alcune di esse, che contribuirono con spirito e fine intelligenza alla storia della villa, dei medici e di firenze stessa nel corso dei secoli. 
perchÃ© sia sempre la giornata del rispetto di tutti, senza eccezioni.

venite dunque a trovarci e a passare questa domenica speciale al giardino. siamo aperti fino alle 16.00!
---
ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ today is the international day for the elimination of violence against women! we want to remember the great women of the medici family, who made the history of our villa. caterina sforza, maria salviati, eleonora di toledo, maria luisa de medici, some of them cooperated with spirit and intelligence to the story of the villa, to the story of medici's family and florence itself.
because today is the day of respect for all, without exception.

come to the garden, so you could spend this special sunday with us. we are open until 4pm!

today is â international elimination of violence against women day â 
1 in 3 women experience sexual or physical abuse. 
by raising awareness we have the ability to reduce and prevent violence against women. "it improves the heath of women and children, reduces risks of acquiring hiv and sexually transmitted infections, improves economic productivity and educational attainment, and reduces the risks of mental illness and substance abuse, among other benefits." - undp

text:
bannon wanted to use the sorts of aggressive messaging tactics usually reserved for geopolitical conflicts to move the us electorate further to the right, wylie said. he had already directed a series of anti-establishment, conservative documentary films and presided over the far-right website breitbart news, but cambridge analytica would mark another step in his overall ambitions to transform the nation.

with financial backing from hedge-fund billionaire robert mercer, bannon co-founded cambridge analytica in 2013 as the us-branch of strategic communication laboratories (scl) group, a british company that advertises how it has conducted "behavioral change" programs in more than 60 countries.

wylie described cambridge analytica as - steve bannon and robert mercer using a foreign, military contractor ... to use some of the same techniques that the military uses ... on the american electorate.

curt devine, donie o'sullivan and drew griffin
cnn

text:
warning: long post

the more i watch this, the more pissed i get. this little boy with his suggestive comments and movements has this little girl penned to a wall between buildings with a hype-man hyping him up. now some may say i'm reading too much into this. its just kids being kids. (that's what they said about the cheeto in chief. boys being boys having locker room talk. his level of disrespect towards women didn't just start as an adult. ) 
i then say, imagine this is your little girl that you sent outside to play and you then came across this video on the internet? how would you feel? and the hype-man recording this mess? wtf?! look at her face. does she seem interested? she's a kid. does she look scared? she's a kid. nervous about what's going on? ğŸ—£she's a kid!

you see, these little boys doing this that people think are cute, then turn into grown men doing the same shit. not so cute anymore right? especially if you don't want the attention. 
i remember being a little girl and little slick ass boys trying to do slick shit to me on the playground. from sticking their hands up my skirt (i rarely wear skirts to this day!), to trying to "hunch" me in the lunch line, to one showing me their "vienna sausage" on the bus one time (never rode the school bus after that), to a few of them telling my cousin they were gonna "get me" after school one day (shout out to cousin cedric for being the best snitch ever and telling my mom who then confronted them in the middle of the street. she can be hood!) i gag thinking of my two girls going through some of these things. (i'll let you guys know my inmate number and address so you can write me.) everyone will have their own opinion. but this is mine. teach your sons to respect girls at an early age. teach your girls respect of their bodies at an early age. things that are "cute" now might lead to a case later. your influence on kids is greater when they're younger. not later when there is a glass separating you. 
sidenote: this is not an attack on mike brooks because he's funny as hell. this is my take on what i'm watching. 
#truth #facts #metoo tag @sophiabush because she is my spirit animal and she gets it!

(i'll let you guys know my inmate number and address so you can write me.) everyone will have their own opinion. but this is mine. teach your sons to respect girls at an early age. teach your girls respect of their bodies at an early age. things that are "cute" now might lead to a case later. your influence on kids is greater when they're younger. not later when there is a glass separating you. 
sidenote: this is not an attack on mike brooks because he's funny as hell. this is my take on what i am watching. 
   tag  because she is my spirit animal and she gets it!

text:
25th of november â€“ international day for the elimination of violence against women â€œ1 in 3 women and girls experience physical or sexual violence in their lifetimeâ€ (un, 2018). .

for many, it might seem as a distant and non-existent figure 
but in my reality, it is an actuality. 
i grew up in ukraine in the soviet union aftermath,
the people filled with fear and wrath, 
a peculiar period marked with shiver of distrust. 
i was taught to never talk, never look, never fuss. .

and it made sense because growing up wasnâ€™t pleasant: 
we all felt their eyes punching holes in our backs like weapons; 
we have all seen or heard the domestic violence behind the closed doors; 
we have all heard whistles and words accompanying us outdoors; 
and with carrying that terrifying phobia of being abused 
we have still moved on with life persistently with no excuse.
.
moving to europe didnâ€™t change the situation generally, 
just made the boundary manifest itself â€˜liberallyâ€™: the consent and other formality are not needed if you are an easy-to-get girl with fun personality; 
at work or at school still not taken seriously for your opinions or abnormalities; 
looked in the eye with lust and carnality; 
and stories of violence not really heard because they make you â€˜inadequateâ€™.
.

i will tell you what. .

societyâ€™s handcrafted deviant â€“
a congenital anomaly, 
should never praise inhumanity valiantly.
.
the time has come for the 3.73 billion souls
to take the stand and to take the hold
utilizing the power to which they were born!
.
(poem by me)

text:
today is the start of 16 days of activism... what is the 16 days activism?

it is a worldwide campaign to oppose violence against women and children
it aims to raise awareness of the negative impact that violence and abuse have on women and children and to rid society of abuse permanently
when does the campaign take place?

the 16 days of activism campaign is held from 25 november to 10 december every year
however, the success of this campaign rests on our daily individual and collective actions to safeguard our society against this cycle of abuse

#16daysofactivism #orangeday #genderequalityforall #thetimeisnow #metoo #itbeginswithyou

text:
sei bella.
e non per quel filo di trucco.
sei bella per quanta vita ti Ã¨ passata addosso,
per i sogni che hai dentro 
e che non conosco.
bella per tutte le volte che toccava a te,
ma avanti il prossimo.
per le parole spese invano
e per quelle cercate lontano.
per ogni lacrima scesa
e per quelle nascoste di notte
al chiaro di luna complice.
per il sorriso che provi,
le attenzioni che non trovi,
per le emozioni che senti
e la speranza che inventi.
sei bella semplicemente, 
come un fiore raccolto in fretta,
come un dono inaspettato,
come uno sguardo rubato
o un abbraccio sentito.
sei bella
e non importa che il mondo sappia,
sei bella davvero,
ma solo per chi ti sa guardare.

the world is not a safe place if our women and girls are not safe! -

on this international day for the elimination of all forms of violence against women, i add my voice to the voices of women and girls and institutions all over the world to say letâ€™s end violence against women and girls in all its forms wherever they occur, including the abolition of harmful traditional practices that continue to dehumanize womanhood. -

text:
today marks the beginning of #16daysofactivism for 2018.

from 25th november, the international day for the elimination of violence against women and girls, to 10th december, human rights day, theÂ 16 days of activism against gender-based violence campaignÂ is a time to galvanize action to end violence against women and girls around the world.

the international campaign originated from the first women's global leadership institute coordinated by the center for women's global leadership in 1991.

in recent years, the voices of survivors and activists, through campaigns such as #metoo, #timesup, #niunamenos, #notonemore, #balancetonporc and more locally #lifeinleggings, among others, have reached a crescendo that cannot be silenced any more.

advocates understand that while the names and contexts may differ across geographic locations, women and girls everywhere are experiencing extensive abuse and their stories need to be brought to light.

this year be will represent some stories we have been aware of over the years through the unite campaignâ€™s global advocacy theme:Â orange the world: #hearmetoo as a means to bring awareness to what girls face daily.

#endviolence #genderviolence #girls #herstory #heartwork #story #likeagirl #advocacy #awakening #awareness #sdg5 #campaign #barbados #pain #cause #charity #change

text:
i've watched the qspiracy since the start.

steve bannon left the wh august last year and q appeared the following october. do you believe in coincidences?

abusing and leaking presidential information to mislead the people and benefit the hijacked party of puppets is obviously just business as usual.

however - while doing this djt with the brave bunch known as gop has willingly opened a pussy wound that anyone around the world can easily contaminate. i like to call it meddlin' with presidental blessin'. i'm not the only one who knows this opportunity and messes with the bombastic patriots - may be russia or china or mbs or antifa or me me me, a tiny quarter pounder sitting on my bed.

the whole qshow seems like a vile roleplay but instead it has become the heart of the propaganda operation that joseph goebbels would have died for. it is obvious that stuff like pizzagateâ„¢ was testing and groundwork for the 2016 election and since it proved to be very effective it is used still, today, right now.

the accompanying memes go way beyond the propaganda of nsdap. social media companies are just helpless with the fake content - there is no way they are going to risk their business by taking a real responsibility.

there is absolutely no way that gop isn't aware of what is going on - after all cambridge analytica worked for ted cruz and john bolton. the whole narrative is built on the same user data that bannon and the mercers reportedly got from cambridge analytica.

and here comes the best part. trumq is truly playing along with his tweets, gestures and words.

the bigger issue still is that requqlicans are willingly piggybacking this lunacy and abusing the faith of their fellow men while campaigning for the midterms. this is not just an insane national security risk - it's a leaking conspiracy and treason in plain sight.

a non

text:
each year, from 25 november marked as the 16 days of activism against gender-based violence to 10 december which calls for action against one of the worldâ€™s most persistent violations of human rights â€“ violence against men, women, and lgbtqi. the global advocacy theme this year is: orange the world: #hearmetoo

violence against gender continues to occur at an alarming scale in every country in the world. too often it is accepted as normal behavior and the global culture of discrimination against women and other genders allows violence to occur with impunity. recent movements such as #metoo and #timesup have propelled this issue onto the global stage. advocates understand that while the names and contexts may differ across geographic locations, women and girls everywhere are experiencing extensive abuse and their stories need to be brought to light.

violence against women is not inevitable; it is preventable. let us tell our families, schools, communities, and workplaces. together, our message will be amplified, and our voices heard.

yuwa reached out to the youth and asked their opinions on #metoo. through this video, we have tried to convey their voice on the #metoo campaign. the views are completely individual's perception and do not reflect upon yuwa's opinion.

full video on: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6dejoyg1xoi

music: chill smooth guitar rap beat / higher (prod. syndrome) [new 2018] syndrome

text:
â€œjust asking for itâ€ 
she said she wasnâ€™t going to do it
that today was just a simple check up 
nothing more, nothing less 
but when the doctor asked her 
about the reason for her visit 
she stared blankly at her 
as if she had forgotten how to speak 
and all at once 
the words came gushing out 
uncontrollably 
like the tears streaming from her eyes.
â€¢
â€¢
â€œi was sexually assaulted a few weeks ago
and i havenâ€™t been able to get over it 
because i blame myself.â€
the doctor simply replied, â€œyou didnâ€™t do anything wrong.
all you did was survive.â€
but the girl hung her head and sobbed.
â€œyou donâ€™t understand,
i consented at first 
but then i asked him to stop.
he didnâ€™t.
i asked him again. 
and he refused.
it hurt. 
he was hurting me. 
i tried to pull my body away from his 
but he just grabbed me 
and swallowed me up in his arms. 
i begged him to stop.
he wouldnâ€™t stop.â€ â€¢
â€¢
men will never know the feeling 
of lying naked on a cold table 
having their bodies examined 
spread open 
with cold tools around and in them 
like we women are lab experiments - 
experimented with and on by some stranger 
and left broken on a bed 
just to be fixed up in an office 
that takes care of these women 
who see us like this 
everyday 
and already know the proper procedure
of tissues and right sentences 
to make the victims feel better â€¢
â€¢
she is on a table getting fixed.
he is on another woman getting pleasure.
â€¢
- hillary dawn mckinney

text:
bannon wanted to use the sorts of aggressive messaging tactics usually reserved for geopolitical conflicts to move the us electorate further to the right, wylie said. he had already directed a series of anti-establishment, conservative documentary films and presided over the far-right website breitbart news, but cambridge analytica would mark another step in his overall ambitions to transform the nation.

with financial backing from hedge-fund billionaire robert mercer, bannon co-founded cambridge analytica in 2013 as the us-branch of strategic communication laboratories (scl) group, a british company that advertises how it has conducted "behavioral change" programs in more than 60 countries.

wylie described cambridge analytica as - steve bannon and robert mercer using a foreign, military contractor ... to use some of the same techniques that the military uses ... on the american electorate.

curt devine, donie o'sullivan and drew griffin
cnn

text:
i come from a patriarchal country where baby girls are considered a burden. majority pakistanis are poor and uneducated and follow age old gender roles. hence, boys are considered a source of income and girls, a source of expense. however, the dynamics are changing as gender roles are being redefined world over. but as women empowerment is gaining momentum, i'm noticing that men are now being villanized (disclaimer: i support women empowerment and #metoo movement). i agree patriachy is at fault and men need to reassess their treatment of women (personally and professionally), but i don't see how little boys are being held responsible. let me explain what i see in my society today.
.
.
.
today i see girls being uplifted but boys being held back. i sometimes feel fear or guilt if i praise my sons too much. i get told that i need a daughter to experience their caring nature as if boys aren't capable of caring. i understand that each gender brings its own set of blessings but why must we create light for one by darkening the other? isn't equality achieved by sharing the light on the basis of merit? why is there a need of putting one gender down to build the other? isn't that exactly what we did with our girls? don't get me wrong, i love that there's a shift in how to raise our children by giving more freedom to girls and limiting the unreasonable freedom given to boys. i totally agree that mothers of boys need to be more responsible and educate their sons regarding the rights of women. i know there are men out there that respect and empower women because they were raised right. my husband is one of them and i hope to raise my boys the same way. my point is to make ourselves more responsible parents instead of supporting gender stereotypes in both cases. let's not celebrate the birth of a boy or girl specifically, let's celebrate the birth of innocent children, of human beings. lets not create a dark cloud over one gender. only then will we be able to make them cherished members of society.
.
.
.
.
#momofboys #motherhood #momlife #momblog #parenting #parenthood #learningtogether #raisinghumanbeings #lovemyfamily #girlsvsboys #womanempowerment #humanity
