text:
the rights of women and girls are fundamental human rights that are protected by our constitution. gender-based violence, in all its different forms, reduce the ability of women and girls to enjoy their rights and live with dignity. today, we start the #16days campaign to end all forms of #gbv in secondary schools, higher institutions, households, and in the world of work. 
the international day for the elimination of violence against women which also marks the beginning of the 16 days of activism against gender based violence is a time to increase awareness about and more importantly take action on the disproportionate levels of violence faced by women and girls in all their diversities in our society. 
the theme for this yearâ€™s campaign is â€˜end gender based violence in the world of workâ€™, recognising that perpetrators of #sgbv are not only strangers! they include family members (fathers, brothers, husbands, uncles, etc); teachers and lecturers in schools, as well as colleagues and bosses in the workplace.

in 2018, building on existing campaigns, recognizing the breaking of the silence with #metoo, we want #hearmetoo to challenge institutions in ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡¬ where #sgbv is perpetuated and overlooked. and that it is ğŸ•› to start working towards systemic change with strong accountability mechanisms. 
join us over the next 16 days as we break the silence by sharing stories of sexual and gender based violence in secondary schools, higher institutions, households and workplaces in nigeria and learn from experts in a series of tweet chats on the ways we can work together to end #sgbv. 
we will also be sharing existing laws that are meant to protect girls and young women against violence in nigeria, the gbv services available, the gaps that need response and our recommendations. #timesup nigeria! 
follow us on twitter @eva_nigeria to catch up with our tweets.
name: EVA Nigeria Official Account
tweet_full:
the rights of women and girls are fundamental human rights that are protected by our constitution. gender-based violence, in all its different forms, reduce the ability of women and girls to enjoy their rights and live with dignity. today, we start the #16days campaign to end all forms of #gbv in secondary schools, higher institutions, households, and in the world of work. 
the international day for the elimination of violence against women which also marks the beginning of the 16 days of activism against gender based violence is a time to increase awareness about and more importantly take action on the disproportionate levels of violence faced by women and girls in all their diversities in our society. 
the theme for this yearâ€™s campaign is â€˜end gender based violence in the world of workâ€™, recognising that perpetrators of #sgbv are not only strangers! they include family members (fathers, brothers, husbands, uncles, etc); teachers and lecturers in schools, as well as colleagues and bosses in the workplace.

text_retweet:
taking over open society foundationsâ€™s instagram for a week with photos from my long term project 'ni una menos' on gender violence and women's movements fight for rights. 
glad to have the opportunity to give visibility on this important and current issue in the week of november 25th, the international day for the elimination of violence against women.
today women will demonstrate in all the world against gender violence.
more info about 'ni una menos' on the website dedicated to the project www.niunamenosproject.com

#repost @opensocietyfoundations
(@get_repost)
â€¢ â€¢ â€¢
the leader of madres victimas de trata, an association of mothers whose daughters were lost to sex trafficking. 
despite a 2012 law which raised the maximum prison sentence for â€œfemicide,â€ the killing of a woman or girl on account of her gender, argentina is still struggling against widespread gender-based violence. thankfully, a grassroots, women-led movement known as ni una menos (not one [woman] less) has arisen in argentina, and is working to empower women and defend their human rights. in this series, karl mancini (@karlitomancini) shares some of his work on the inspiring women of ni una menos and their fight for justice. to learn more about both mancini's work and ni una menos, please follow the link in our bio.

text:
today is international day for the elimination of violence against women, a day where we remember and attempt to raise awareness that women and young girls are victims of various forms of violence. 
no matter how bad we think the problem is, itâ€™s actually a lot worse in reality. many women walk amongst us hiding the physical and emotional scars of previous and ongoing abuse. 
1/3rd of the women worldwide have experienced some form of violence in their lives. so it really is a problem if great importance. 
today, we stand with anti-violence advocates and groups and defenders of womenâ€™s rights who work tirelessly to prevent and end violence against women and girls. not only that we encourage you to #orangetheworld and find your own way to join the fight. every little helps. 
#internationaldayfortheeliminationofviolenceagainstwomen  #internationaldayfortheeliminationofviolenceagainstwomen2018 #mirabelsisters #stopfemalefoeticide #stopfemaleviolence #enddomesticviolenceandsexualassault #enddomesticviolence #endrape #endsexualharassment #stopsexualharassment #metoo #timesup #endfgm #endfgm2030 #endslavery #endsexualviolence

text:
"him"
i want him to shout loud,
to let his loneliness fade away.
but then society wants him to be strong
for he is a man and he has to pay.

he is mumma's boy and gets mocked,
for someone said man are built muscular.
his teardrops are never seen by anyone,
deep inside if someone sees them is his fear.

good men are hard to find is what people believe,
"you aren't like other's" is what i want to hear.
there are thousand ways to blame him,
but not even single way to make his words clear.

in the shame everyday, he's being called pervert,
wounds are internal you won't see them.
not every man is a culprit, some are victims too,
some can be feminist and even have #metoo in them.

@poetrybypriyanshi via @priyanshi.jain05

1. be concerned about who your children are with and know their friends.
2. fathers should not bath their girl child: if itâ€™s avoidable.
3. donâ€™t let everyone have access to your children, observe those around your children.

6. fathers need to be present and not just drop money.

text:
this is why sen. cindy hyde-smith should be voted out of any leadership for our country. 
read this article  never again........ the mob then tied her ankles, hung her upside down from a tree, doused her in gasoline and motor oil and set her on fire.
while turner was still alive, a member of the mob split her abdomen open with a knife. her unborn child fell on the ground, where it gave a cry before it was stomped on and crushed. finally, turner's body was riddled with hundreds of bullets. mary turner and her child were cut down and buried near the tree, with a whiskey bottle marking the grave.
according to philip dray, â€œthere, before a crowd that included women and children, mary was stripped, hung upside down by the ankles, soaked with gasoline, and roasted to death. in the midst of this torment, a white man opened her swollen belly with a hunting knife and her infant fell to the grown, gave a cry, and was stomped to death. the constitutionâ€™s coverage of the killing was subheaded-lined: â€˜fury of the people is unrestrained.â€™ link to sen. cindy hyde-smith  https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2018/11/24/cindy-hyde-smith-attended-segregation-school-praised-confederates-legislation/2105314002/

#weremember  #hatecrimes #unitedstatesofamerica #america  #wethepeople #endhate #endprejudice #enddiscrimination #votethemout #vote2020 #mississippi #changeisnow #vote2018 #neverforget #humanity #humanrights #internationalday  #standagainstwomenviolence #equalityforall #metoo #hearmetoo #equality

text: what the actual fuck?! this is the guardian! #metoo wasn't about sex. it was about rape, sexual assault, harassment, stalking and intimidation. if you can't tell the difference between that stuff and sex stop having sex, you're doing it wrong. and i'm sure sharon theobald is being quoted out of context but "anger isn't going to get us anywhere"...?! honestly if women could end sexual violence by fluttering our eyelashes and asking nicely it would have ended several centuries ago. we're right to be angry, more people should be angry, it's the only thing that's going to bring change. and how can we be in the post #metoo era already? #metoo started like one year ago. basically every woman on earth turns out to have been a victim of sexual harassment or assault and so far only bill cosby has gone to jail. i am not done talking about this. i'm still angry. see you in ludlow tonight, perth australia in feb, more u.k. dates in march-may...! #katesmurthwaite #ludlow #metoo @guardian #theguardian #guardian #perth #tour #comedy #feminism
name: Kate Smurthwaite

text:
on todayâ€™s international day for the elimination of violence against women: 1 in 3 women and girls will still experience physical or sexual violence in their lifetime, most frequently by an intimate partner.
â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €
violence against women and girls (vawg) is one of the most widespread, persistent and devastating human rights violations in our world today remains largely unreported due to the impunity, silence, stigma and shame surrounding it.
â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €
in general terms, it manifests itself in physical, sexual and psychological forms, encompassing: intimate partner violence; sexual violence and harassment; human trafficking; female genital mutilation; and child marriage.
â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €
violence against women and girls and the impact this has on their mental health needs to end. â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €
if you are worried that your relationship, or that of a friend or family member, is controlling or unsafe, visit women's aid or call the freephone 24/7 national domestic violence helpline, run by womenâ€™s aid in partnership with refuge, on 0808 2000 247. #endvaw

text:
bannon wanted to use the sorts of aggressive messaging tactics usually reserved for geopolitical conflicts to move the us electorate further to the right, wylie said. he had already directed a series of anti-establishment, conservative documentary films and presided over the far-right website breitbart news, but cambridge analytica would mark another step in his overall ambitions to transform the nation.

with financial backing from hedge-fund billionaire robert mercer, bannon co-founded cambridge analytica in 2013 as the us-branch of strategic communication laboratories (scl) group, a british company that advertises how it has conducted "behavioral change" programs in more than 60 countries.

wylie described cambridge analytica as - steve bannon and robert mercer using a foreign, military contractor ... to use some of the same techniques that the military uses ... on the american electorate.

curt devine, donie o'sullivan and drew griffin
cnn

violenza Ã¨ quando non si lascia lâ€™opportunitÃ  alle donne di abortire in pace, e chiedere se faranno dei figli senza sapere nulla della loro storia personale. 
violenza Ã¨ quando date un pugno e una carezza in un pomeriggio, quando si chiede â€œcomâ€™era vestita?â€ nei casi di stupro.

esser riluttanti quando una donna ottiene una promozione, come se il merito non fosse mai menzionato. 
scegliere di essere aggressivi in classe e nelle nostre case. 
violenza Ã¨ decidere di non educare alla paritÃ , fomentare gli stereotipi e costruire muri. anche con lâ€™indifferenza.

text:
bannon wanted to use the sorts of aggressive messaging tactics usually reserved for geopolitical conflicts to move the us electorate further to the right, wylie said. he had already directed a series of anti-establishment, conservative documentary films and presided over the far-right website breitbart news, but cambridge analytica would mark another step in his overall ambitions to transform the nation.

with financial backing from hedge-fund billionaire robert mercer, bannon co-founded cambridge analytica in 2013 as the us-branch of strategic communication laboratories (scl) group, a british company that advertises how it has conducted "behavioral change" programs in more than 60 countries.

wylie described cambridge analytica as - steve bannon and robert mercer using a foreign, military contractor ... to use some of the same techniques that the military uses ... on the american electorate.

curt devine, donie o'sullivan and drew griffin
cnn

text:
bannon wanted to use the sorts of aggressive messaging tactics usually reserved for geopolitical conflicts to move the us electorate further to the right, wylie said. he had already directed a series of anti-establishment, conservative documentary films and presided over the far-right website breitbart news, but cambridge analytica would mark another step in his overall ambitions to transform the nation.

with financial backing from hedge-fund billionaire robert mercer, bannon co-founded cambridge analytica in 2013 as the us-branch of strategic communication laboratories (scl) group, a british company that advertises how it has conducted "behavioral change" programs in more than 60 countries.

wylie described cambridge analytica as - steve bannon and robert mercer using a foreign, military contractor ... to use some of the same techniques that the military uses ... on the american electorate.

curt devine, donie o'sullivan and drew griffin
cnn

text:
this is why sen. cindy hyde-smith should be voted out of any leadership for our country. 
read this article  never again........ the mob then tied her ankles, hung her upside down from a tree, doused her in gasoline and motor oil and set her on fire.
while turner was still alive, a member of the mob split her abdomen open with a knife. her unborn child fell on the ground, where it gave a cry before it was stomped on and crushed. finally, turner's body was riddled with hundreds of bullets. mary turner and her child were cut down and buried near the tree, with a whiskey bottle marking the grave.
according to philip dray, â€œthere, before a crowd that included women and children, mary was stripped, hung upside down by the ankles, soaked with gasoline, and roasted to death. in the midst of this torment, a white man opened her swollen belly with a hunting knife and her infant fell to the grown, gave a cry, and was stomped to death. the constitutionâ€™s coverage of the killing was subheaded-lined: â€˜fury of the people is unrestrained.â€™ link to sen. cindy hyde-smith  https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2018/11/24/cindy-hyde-smith-attended-segregation-school-praised-confederates-legislation/2105314002/

text:
- bannon got it immediately. he believes in the whole andrew breitbart doctrine that politics is downstream from culture, so to change politics you need to change culture. and fashion trends are a useful proxy for that. trump is like a pair of uggs, or crocs, basically. so how do you get from people thinking â€˜ugh. totally uglyâ€™ to the moment when everyone is wearing them? that was the inflection point he was looking for.

is what cambridge analytica does akin to bullying? - i think itâ€™s worse than bullying, christopher wylie says. - because people donâ€™t necessarily know itâ€™s being done to them. at least bullying respects the agency of people because they know. so itâ€™s worse, because if you do not respect the agency of people, anything that youâ€™re doing after that point is not conducive to a democracy. and fundamentally, information warfare is not conducive to democracy.

millions of peopleâ€™s personal information was stolen and used to target them in ways they wouldnâ€™t have seen, and couldnâ€™t have known about, by a mercenary outfit, cambridge analytica, who, wylie says, â€œwould work for anyoneâ€. who would pitch to russian oil companies. would they subvert elections abroad on behalf of foreign governments?

it occurs to me to ask wylie this one night. - yes.

nato or non-nato? - either. i mean theyâ€™re mercenaries. theyâ€™ll work for pretty much anyone who pays.

itâ€™s an incredible revelation. it also encapsulates all of the problems of outsourcing â€“ at a global scale, with added cyberweapons. and in the middle of it all are the public â€“ our intimate family connections, our â€œlikesâ€, our crumbs of personal data, all sucked into a swirling black hole thatâ€™s expanding and growing and is now owned by a politically motivated billionaire.

carole cadwalladr
the guardian

text:
- bannon got it immediately. he believes in the whole andrew breitbart doctrine that politics is downstream from culture, so to change politics you need to change culture. and fashion trends are a useful proxy for that. trump is like a pair of uggs, or crocs, basically. so how do you get from people thinking â€˜ugh. totally uglyâ€™ to the moment when everyone is wearing them? that was the inflection point he was looking for.

is what cambridge analytica does akin to bullying? - i think itâ€™s worse than bullying, christopher wylie says. - because people donâ€™t necessarily know itâ€™s being done to them. at least bullying respects the agency of people because they know. so itâ€™s worse, because if you do not respect the agency of people, anything that youâ€™re doing after that point is not conducive to a democracy. and fundamentally, information warfare is not conducive to democracy.

millions of peopleâ€™s personal information was stolen and used to target them in ways they wouldnâ€™t have seen, and couldnâ€™t have known about, by a mercenary outfit, cambridge analytica, who, wylie says, â€œwould work for anyoneâ€. who would pitch to russian oil companies. would they subvert elections abroad on behalf of foreign governments?

it occurs to me to ask wylie this one night. - yes.

nato or non-nato? - either. i mean theyâ€™re mercenaries. theyâ€™ll work for pretty much anyone who pays.

itâ€™s an incredible revelation. it also encapsulates all of the problems of outsourcing â€“ at a global scale, with added cyberweapons. and in the middle of it all are the public â€“ our intimate family connections, our â€œlikesâ€, our crumbs of personal data, all sucked into a swirling black hole thatâ€™s expanding and growing and is now owned by a politically motivated billionaire.

carole cadwalladr
the guardian

text:
i was 11 when it started. it stopped when i was 16. i found out almost ten years later. .
.
.
a year after finding out, i still canâ€˜t believe how well my mind repressed these memories. itâ€˜s still hard to accept that they are now part of my history. itâ€™s still hard to use that word. especially, since i kept hiding from it strategically. 
i had to learn how to live with this feeling first. that feeling that makes you want to rib off your skin and burn it. that shame and guilt that comes with it. i am still learning how to make these feeling part of my history and not letting it into my everyday live takes some strength from time to time.
.
.
.
i am taking baby steps towards healing. 
i am save.
i survived.
and i am not going to give up until i create the life that i deserve. .
.
.
thank you @la_frecks for reminding me of the international day of elemantion of violence against women. thank you for reminding women to raise their voices. â¤ï¸
.
.
.
#hearmetoo #metoo #childhoodsurvivor #ificansocanyou #healing #healingjourney #recovery #empoweredwomenempowerwomen  #loveyourself

text:
ğŸ§¡ reminders in orange from the everyday, compiled on the international day for the elimination of violence against women.
to be honest, as a survivor of relationship violence, i find the framing of this issue to be problematic, even among international organizations. too often, it is portrayed as something that only happens to the "uneducated", to the "poor", to those with "low self-esteem" or who have deep, underlying psychological issues. it becomes associated with non-western culture and thus frees western males of the emotional responsibility of facing the issue, and only ever includes discourse on direct physical/sexual violence and outright insults. 
the problem is that violence against women includes so much more, which is why i remained in a terrible situation for so long and took so long to admit it afterwards. i was ashamed to admit that it was happening to me.
the discussion must include respecting women for their sexuality and admitting when we tend to objectify them for it. it must include full cultural respect for "career women", housewives, transgender women, sex workers, immigrant women, and the end of any sort of dichotomization of "types of" women. it must push men to engage in emotional labor (and if you don't know what that is, google exists. you can figure it out for yourself ;) ). it must include electing leaders who respect our autonomy, our very existence. the discourse must show that violence against women has nothing to do with the status of the woman herself, nor her own actions or psychology, but that it weighs upon transforming the psychological perception of women on the part of peoples of all genders.
because i'm really tired of seeing a therapist for the men in my life who won't. #unwomen #16daysofactivism #metoo #timesup #internationaldayfortheeliminationofviolenceagainstwomen #unitednations #hearmetoo ğŸ§¡

text:
wylie said that bannon's plans began to solidify in 2014, when cambridge analytica consulted various republican campaigns and pacs ahead of the midterm elections. the company began to test and apply its psychographics by using facebook data to model individuals' personality types in order to understand how to influence them.

documents show the john bolton super pac, which promoted candidates supported by recently appointed white house national security adviser john bolton, paid cambridge analytical $454,700 in 2014 for "behavioral microtargeting with psychographic messaging." those services included strategies that broke individual voters into "clusters" based on what messages would resonate with them.

wylie also said the company used focus groups and messaging trials in 2014 to test some of the concepts that became core themes of the trump campaign, such as "drain the swamp" and imagery of walls. "a lot of the narratives of the trump campaign were what we were testing in 2014," wylie said.

he added that bannon directly presided over much of the company's initial research. "everything that we were doing ultimately had to be passed up to bannon for approval," said wylie, who left the company in late 2014.

wylie said bannon would fly to london about once a month for company meetings, and during that time he came to understand bannon's ideology. "he really liked the idea of using a military-style approach to changing people's perceptions," wylie said.

curt devine, donie o'sullivan & drew griffin
cnn

text:
this was a serious business, it was actually backed by goldman sachs, but it crashed and went bankrupt because the gamers themselves who weren't cheating became enraged basically that these other people were doing, they put so much pressure on the gaming companies.

they put so much pressure on the video game companies, that they decided to basically ban gold-farming, which killed bannon's business, but it awakened him to the power of what he called "rootless white males" who spend all their time online. and five years later when bannon wound up at breitbart, he resolved to try and attract those people over to breitbart because he thought they could be radicalized in a kind of populist, nationalist way. and the way that bannon did that, the bridge between the angry abusive gamers and breitbart and pepe was milo yiannopoulous, who bannon discovered and hired to be breitbart's tech editor.

from the time i met him in 2011, he's had exactly the same politics. the same stuff you heard from trump, you saw on the campaign trail. what he was looking for was a vessel because nobody in republican washington believed in these kinds of ideas. the whole trend in the republican party was toward liberalizing immigration laws, passing comprehensive immigration reform. he was against it.

joshua green
devil's bargain: steve bannon, donald trump, and the storming of the presidency

text:
hoy 25 de noviembre es el dÃ­a internacional de la eliminaciÃ³n de la violencia contra la mujer.

por lo general hay muchas cifras y estadÃ­sticas horribles que nos ayudan a comprender porque hay que seguir luchando contra la vida basada en gÃ©nero (vbg) y este aÃ±o ha sido muy significativo con movimientos como los de #metoo y casos legales como el de "la mandada". pero hoy me quiero enfocar en las cosas simples que refuerzan esa cultura donde se naturaliza la vbg. 
cuando hablo de estos temas en las charlas que doy hacemos el ejercicio de los regalos que damos a las niÃ±as y a los niÃ±os, cÃ³mo se ve en esta foto (tomada ayer de un catÃ¡logo que me dieron) lo mÃ¡s regular es la muÃ±eca a la niÃ±a (desarrollando habilidades de cuidado) y carritos de carrera a los niÃ±os (desarrollando habilidades psicomotoras, de liderazgo, haciÃ©ndolo sentir campeÃ³n) y vemos en la imagen como debe ser la niÃ±a, tierna; y la expresiÃ³n del niÃ±o de ganador.

y quÃ© sucede cuando esos es lo que formamos? estamos enseÃ±ando a las niÃ±as a ser mamÃ¡s y amas de casa (que son habilidades buenas, pero tenemos que fomentar mÃ¡s cosas) y al niÃ±o le enseÃ±amos a alcanzar sus metas, ser un ganador (que tampoco estÃ¡ mal, pero tambiÃ©n necesita aprender sobre ser cuidador y ser parte del mantenimiento del hogar). cÃ³mo podemos cambiar eso? dejar de ver los juguetes "rosados" y "azul" permitirles escoger, fomentar actividades que salgan de esa caja de eso es de niÃ±a o de niÃ±o. 
sÃ© que es un post un poco pesado, y me quedo corta para todo lo que podemos hablar de esto, pero quisiera saber quÃ© opinan?

can she share threats that she receives for fighing with violence against women? we'll shout it from the rooftops- no matter what, sexual violence is never. her. fault.

text:
today begins our #16daysofartivism to support art to end violence against women.  from now until 12/10, @create_2030 will be sharing relevant artwork.  join along and share your favorite music, films, photographs, poems or more on #16days using #create2030 and #hearmetoo!

about 16 days of activism:

on november 25, 1960, three sisters, patria mercedes mirabal, marÃ­a argentina minerva mirabal and antonia marÃ­a teresa mirabal, were assassinated in the dominican republic on the orders of the dominican ruler rafael trujillo. the mirabel sisters fought hard to end trujillo's dictatorship. activists on women's rights have observed a day against violence on the anniversary of the deaths of these three women since 1981.

under the theme orange the world: #hearmetoo, the unite partners are encouraged to host events with local, national, regional and global womenâ€™s movements, survivor advocates and women human rights defenders and create opportunities for dialogue between activists, policy-makers and the public. as in previous years, the colour orange will be a key theme unifying all activities, with buildings and landmarks lit and decorated in orange to bring global attention to the initiative.

help us highlight the work of artivists around the world who are using their talents to elevate calls to end violence against women. follow the twitter campaign on twitter.com/create_2030.

#unitednations #16daysofactivism #16days #orangetheworld #artivism #wd2019 #heforshe #sayno #metoo #timesup #idevaw #idevaw2018 #diacontralaviolenciadegenero #noustoutes

about 16 days of activism:

on november 25, 1960, three sisters, patria mercedes mirabal, marÃ­a argentina minerva mirabal and antonia marÃ­a teresa mirabal, were assassinated in the dominican republic on the orders of the dominican ruler rafael trujillo. the mirabel sisters fought hard to end trujillo's dictatorship. activists on women's rights have observed a day against violence on the anniversary of the deaths of these three women since 1981.

under the theme orange the world:  the unite paners are encouraged to host events with local, national, regional and global womenâ€™s movements, survivor advocates and women human rights defenders and create oppounities for dialogue between activists, policy-makers and the public. as in previous years, the colour orange will be a key theme unifying all activities, with buildings and landmarks lit and decorated in orange to bring global attention to the initiative.

help us highlight the work of aivists around the world who are using their talents to elevate calls to end violence against women. follow the twitter campaign on twitter.com/create_2030.

text:
"in recent years, the voices of survivors and activists, through campaigns such as #metoo, #timesup, #niunamenos, #notonemore, #balancetonporc and others, have reached a crescendo that cannot be silenced any more. advocates understand that while the names and contexts may differ across geographic locations, women and girls everywhere are experiencing extensive abuse and their stories need to be brought to light." - un women

specifically for those who have conditions associated with infertility (such as endometriosis and pcos), it is known that "intimate partner violence (ipv), gender-based violence (gbv) and domestic violence have been shown to have significant associations with individuals and couples suffering from unwanted childlessness or involuntary infertility" (who, 2018). today, november 25 is international day for the elimination of violence against women. this is an important date marking the beginning of 16 days of activism, culminating in human rights day on december 10.  #hearmetoo
#endviolence 
#sdg5 
#genderequality
#orangetheworld

text:
join us this upcoming wednesday, november 28th at 2pm in room s737 as we present an exclusive workshop on sex, consent, and communication. what does consent really mean? what is considered sexual harassment? does no always mean no? these questions and more will be explored in this incredible workshop featuring professional actors from the @cunycat74 nyc creative arts team. this is a must-attend event for young brothers and sisters navigating college life. see you there. salute!
-

la convocatoria fue iniciada por el movimiento feminista latinoamericano enÂ 1981Â en conmemoraciÃ³n a la fecha en la que fueron asesinadas por mandato del dictador rafael leonidas trujillo, en 1960, patria, minerva y maria teresa mirabal. 
las mariposas, como eran sus nombres cladestinos, fueron organizadoras del movimiento que intentaba eliminar la dictadora trujillista en conjunto a sus respectivos esposos.  en 1993, en asamblea general, las naciones unidas (onu) aprobaron laÂ declaraciÃ³n , y en 1999, a propuesta de laÂ repÃºblica dominicanaÂ con el apoyo de 60 paÃ­ses mÃ¡s, declararon elÂ 25 de noviembre como dÃ­a internacional de la eliminaciÃ³n de la violencia contra la mujer.

text:
taking a break from promoting my album bc i was taken aback by this conversation between men who get it. unfortunately i haven't seen enough of this. â €
â €
there's only so much we can say and do as women, y'all have to start having these conversations with each other. take responsibility for your actions, take action to remove the deeply ingrained social conditioning of toxic masculinity. it's never too late to learn new behaviors, to ask questions and to look in the mirror and decide who you want to be.â €
â €
bravo @cthagod & @lewishowes may we keep this conversation going!â €
â €

text:
inspirational hollywood couple!!!!!!!!!!!
while on the red carpet event for the #metoo movement, i had the opportunity to talk with the most inspirational hollywood couple, that i truly admire for the role models they are... rebecca and terry crews. 
many people wonder how in the world can a relationship in hollywood survive with all the temptation? tune in and find out as rebecca crews explains it perfectly...and terry's point of view really opened my heart!

what is the best advice you have received to avoid temptation? i would love to know!

text:
on wednesday the advocate qc, simon di rollo, who represented me in a civil rape case will discuss representation for rape complainers in criminal cases. i will be attending on wednesday to hear the advocates opinions.

as the only person who has been through both a criminal trial (no legal representation) and then a civil case (with legal representation) i was interviewed by the @scotnational for my comments.

#fightingforjustice . ** i would like to highlight that it was not the fact the surgeon didnâ€™t turn up but rather he was never asked to attend ** .

#metoo #16daysofactivism #16days #metoomovement #missm #rapesurvivor #scotslaw

one in three women experience violence in their lifetime, across all social status, class, race, country or age group. thatâ€™s one too many. for many of them, the #metoo moment hasnâ€™t come yet, because speaking out can have fatal consequences, and survival is a long and complicated journey.

let us help put to an end violence against women and violence in general.

text:
lo que ella quiere decir cuando dice no:
1. no
.
hoy se conmemora el dÃ­a internacional de la eliminaciÃ³n de la violencia contra las mujeres. sin duda, un problema de todos. es increÃ­ble que en una argentina del siglo xxi sigamos teniendo miedo por nosotras y por nuestras hijas. que se siga escuchando / justificando el "es que llevaba una pollera muy corta", es que "le provocaba celos" o argumentos semejantes.
.
creo que va siendo hora que nos comprometamos con este tema y que luchemos contra nuestros propios prejuicios. y las que venimos con una cultura antigua y machista (porque nos criaron en una sociedad donde eso era lo "normal") hagamos un esfuerzo por abrir nuestra mente y sobretodo que aprendamos y escuchemos a las nuevas generaciones que sobre esto tienen mucho que decir
.
.
.

ğŸ—£ï¸over the past 20 years, every year, the v-day spotlight campaign calls attention to a particular group of women who are experiencing elevated levels of violence and disproportionate socio-political marginalization, in an effort to raise awareness for the issues they face and aid the community groups working to address these injustices. . .ğŸ—£ï¸this year v-dayâ€™s spotlight will include advocates for decarceration of women in prison and for programs in prisons, jails and detention centers whose goal is to help them process their experiences and heal. these advocates acknowledge, as do many in the decarceration movement, that the past violence and poverty experienced by women is often a direct pipeline to incarceration. . .ğŸ—£ï¸ the vast majority of women in prison would not be there if there were adequate resources in their own communities that provided education, jobs, mental health and physical health treatment. .
.ğŸ—£ï¸if you have interest to take the stage and share your story,  your experience and advocacy around this societal problem, please sign up.  link in bio.  please #reshare this post. . . .

text:
leadership and members of ni una menos assembled in buenos aires before a historic march against gender-based violence. 
despite a 2012 law which raised the maximum prison sentence for â€œfemicide,â€ the killing of a woman or girl on account of her gender, argentina is still struggling against widespread gender-based violence. thankfully, a grassroots, women-led movement known as ni una menos (not one [woman] less) has arisen in argentina, and is working to empower women and defend their human rights. in this series, karl mancini (@karlitomancini) shares some of his work on the inspiring women of ni una menos and their fight for justice. to learn more about both mancini's work and ni una menos, please follow the link in our bio. 
#opensociety #argentina #niunamenos #femicide #femicidio #conmisderechosnotemetas #16days #genderbasedviolence #metoo #hearmetoo

text:
i know the pain, hurt, betrayal, grief that comes with this. i also know the strength, recovery, love on the flipside.  i am a survivor. i am fortunate. 
this must stop! 
@regran_ed from @criminalise.abuse -  today is the international day for the elimination of violence against women. 
the world has been marking this day since 1999. 
honestly? we think nearly twenty years is long enough to work out that this problem isnâ€™t getting any better.
awareness is not resulting in any tangible change. 
itâ€™s time for law reform that makes men accountable. 
sign the petition to criminalise nonviolent abuse at: 
http://criminaliseabuse.com 
maybe one year soon we wonâ€™t need to mark this day on our calendars. 
#criminaliseabuse #abuseisviolence #stopabuse #noexcuseforabuse #familyviolence #fv #domesticviolence #dv #violenceagainstwomen #rape #rapesurvivor #sexualassault #sexualassaultsurvivor #abuse #survivor #abusesurvivor #believewomen #believefemmes #believesurvivors #ibelieveher #ibelievethem #wearesurvivors #survivorsareeverywhere #metoo #womenswave - #regrann

text:
orange the world: #hearmetoo
â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”
today starts the @sayno_unite initiative of 16 days of activism to end gender-based violence. today is international day for the elimination of violence against women and december 10th, the 16th day is human rights day. â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”-
launched in 2008, united nations unite to end violence against women campaign is a multi-year effort aimed at preventing and eliminating violence against women and girls around the world.
unite calls on governments, civil society, womenâ€™s organizations, young people, the private sector, the media and the entire un system to join forces in addressing the global pandemic of violence against women and girls.
the campaign builds on existing international legal and policy frameworks, and works to synergize the efforts of all un offices and agencies working to end violence against women. it sets out five key outcomes to be achieved in all countries by 2015:
* adoption and enforcement of national laws to address and punish all forms of violence against women and girls, in line with international human rights standards.
* adoption and implementation of multi-sectoral national plans of action that emphasize prevention and are adequately resourced.
* establishment of data collection and analysis systems, on the prevalence of various forms of violence against women and girls.
* establishment of national and/or local campaigns and the engagement of a diverse range of civil society actors in preventing violence and in supporting women and girls who have been abused.
* systematic efforts to address sexual violence in conflict situations and to protect women and girls from rape as a tactic of war, and the full implementation of related laws and policies.
sign up for news and action alerts via @sayno_unite â€”â€”-
spread the word, attend an event, sign up for action alerts! â€”â€”-
#unitednations #badasscrossstitch #hearmetoo #metoo #timesup #niunamenos #notonemore #balancetonporc #craftivism #craftivist #feminism #feminist #resist #persist

text:
the annual 16 days of activism against gender-based violence start today, on the international day for the elimination of violence against women. its purpose is to center the prevention and elimination of violence against women and girls in all its forms, including fgm, the most brutal act of violence against women in the world. this year's theme is orange the world: #hearmetoo.  it was chosen to lift up the work done by grassroots activists and survivor advocates such as #metoo, #niunamenos, #balancetonporc and #notonemore. kota takes part in these 16 days of activism and goes orange to raise awareness on the serious women's rights violations.â €
â €
#goorange #16daysofactivism #feminism #endgenderbasedviolence #womensrights #genderequality #endfgm

- bannon got it immediately. he believes in the whole andrew breitbart doctrine that politics is downstream from culture, so to change politics you need to change culture. and fashion trends are a useful proxy for that. trump is like a pair of uggs, or crocs, basically. so how do you get from people thinking â€˜ugh. totally uglyâ€™ to the moment when everyone is wearing them? that was the inflection point he was looking for.

is what cambridge analytica does akin to bullying? - i think itâ€™s worse than bullying, christopher wylie says. - because people donâ€™t necessarily know itâ€™s being done to them. at least bullying respects the agency of people because they know. so itâ€™s worse, because if you do not respect the agency of people, anything that youâ€™re doing after that point is not conducive to a democracy. and fundamentally, information warfare is not conducive to democracy.

millions of peopleâ€™s personal information was stolen and used to target them in ways they wouldnâ€™t have seen, and couldnâ€™t have known about, by a mercenary outfit, cambridge analytica, who, wylie says, â€œwould work for anyoneâ€. who would pitch to russian oil companies. would they subvert elections abroad on behalf of foreign governments?

it occurs to me to ask wylie this one night. - yes.

nato or non-nato? - either. i mean theyâ€™re mercenaries. theyâ€™ll work for pretty much anyone who pays.

itâ€™s an incredible revelation. it also encapsulates all of the problems of outsourcing â€“ at a global scale, with added cyberweapons. and in the middle of it all are the public â€“ our intimate family connections, our â€œlikesâ€, our crumbs of personal data, all sucked into a swirling black hole thatâ€™s expanding and growing and is now owned by a politically motivated billionaire.

carole cadwalladr
the guardian

is what cambridge analytica does akin to bullying? - i think itâ€™s worse than bullying, christopher wylie says. - because people donâ€™t necessarily know itâ€™s being done to them. at least bullying respects the agency of people because they know. so itâ€™s worse, because if you do not respect the agency of people, anything that youâ€™re doing after that point is not conducive to a democracy. and fundamentally, information warfare is not conducive to democracy.

text:
sei bella.
e non per quel filo di trucco.
sei bella per quanta vita ti Ã¨ passata addosso, per i sogni che hai dentro e che non conosco.
bella per tutte le volte che toccava a te, ma avanti il prossimo.
per le parole spese invano
e per quelle cercate lontano.
per ogni lacrima scesa
e per quelle nascoste di notte
al chiaro di luna complice.
per il sorriso che provi,
le attenzioni che non trovi,
per le emozioni che senti
e la speranza che inventi.
sei bella semplicemente, 
come un fiore raccolto in fretta,
come un dono inaspettato,
come uno sguardo rubato
o un abbraccio sentito.
sei bella
e non importa che il mondo sappia, sei bella davvero,
ma solo per chi ti sa guardare.

alda merini

text_retweet:
#repost from @opensocietyfoundations with @regram.app ... leadership and members of ni una menos assembled in buenos aires before a historic march against gender-based violence. 
despite a 2012 law which raised the maximum prison sentence for â€œfemicide,â€ the killing of a woman or girl on account of her gender, argentina is still struggling against widespread gender-based violence. thankfully, a grassroots, women-led movement known as ni una menos (not one [woman] less) has arisen in argentina, and is working to empower women and defend their human rights. in this series, karl mancini (@karlitomancini) shares some of his work on the inspiring women of ni una menos and their fight for justice. to learn more about both mancini's work and ni una menos, please follow the link in our bio. 
#opensociety #argentina #niunamenos #femicide #femicidio #conmisderechosnotemetas #16days #genderbasedviolence #metoo #hearmetoo

text:
orange the world: #hearmetoo
â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”
today starts the @sayno_unite initiative of 16 days of activism to end gender-based violence. today is international day for the elimination of violence against women and december 10th, the 16th day is human rights day. â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”-
launched in 2008, united nations unite to end violence against women campaign is a multi-year effort aimed at preventing and eliminating violence against women and girls around the world.
unite calls on governments, civil society, womenâ€™s organizations, young people, the private sector, the media and the entire un system to join forces in addressing the global pandemic of violence against women and girls.
the campaign builds on existing international legal and policy frameworks, and works to synergize the efforts of all un offices and agencies working to end violence against women. it sets out five key outcomes to be achieved in all countries by 2015:
* adoption and enforcement of national laws to address and punish all forms of violence against women and girls, in line with international human rights standards.
* adoption and implementation of multi-sectoral national plans of action that emphasize prevention and are adequately resourced.
* establishment of data collection and analysis systems, on the prevalence of various forms of violence against women and girls.
* establishment of national and/or local campaigns and the engagement of a diverse range of civil society actors in preventing violence and in supporting women and girls who have been abused.
* systematic efforts to address sexual violence in conflict situations and to protect women and girls from rape as a tactic of war, and the full implementation of related laws and policies.
sign up for news and action alerts via @sayno_unite â€”â€”-
spread the word, attend an event, sign up for action alerts! â€”â€”-

text_retweet:
for all the violence committed on you,for all the humiliations she suffered,for your body that you have exploited,for his intelligence you have trampled,for the ignorance in which you left it,for the freedom you denied it,for the mouth you plugged it,for the wings you cut them,
for all of this:standing, gentlemen, in front of a woman.
â€˜
â€˜
november 25th. international day against violence against women.

text: today, november 25th, marks the start of #16daysofactivism ,ending on dec 10th, human rights day. this annual 16 day campaign designated by the united nations is designed to bring awareness to gender based violence and to galvanize action to end violence towards women and girls internationally. today, on the international day for the elimination of violence against women, i encourage you to wear a little bit of orange to show support for the #hearmetoo theme this year. letâ€™s talk numbers. 1 in 3 women or girls experience physical or sexual violence in their life, typically at the hands of an intimate partner. 71% of human trafficking victims are women and girls. 200 million women and girls have been subject to female genital mutilation, which is still a major problem in many parts of the world. today, and during this 16 day campaign, some things you can do to be proactive are 1. give survivors a safe space to talk about their experiences. listen to them.. thank them for their bravery. 2. educate yourself on the violence surrounding women and girls today. the united nations website is a wonderful resource to start with. 3. attend a public event surrounding the topic and get involved. the more we can do collectively to spread awareness, educate, and allow survivors a safe welcoming space to process their experiences are baby steps we can all take towards making our world safer for women and girls. i took this photo from a hotel hallway window in york, england, where i was starting a ma in applied human rights before i decided to go with another us university. i thought the photo was fitting for today, given the reason i was there. equal rights are human rights, and so are womenâ€™s rights ğŸ–¤ finally, as a counselor with crisis text line, i would encourage anyone who needs or wants to talk with a counselor via text within the united states about these topics to text 741741- were here for you xx much love #endvaw #orangetheworld #orangeurworld #endgenderbasedviolence #unitednations #unwomen #humanrights #activism #16days #thismattersnow #metoo #violence #intimatepartnerviolence #fgm #humantrafficking #awareness #educate #survivors #assault #ctl #crisistextline

text:
chains and boundaries. [trigger warning] â–ªï¸
today is international day of elimination of violence against women, and it is harrowing to read the statistics. at least  100 uk women killed by men or where a man is the principal suspect by 24 september this year 100 women in 267 days is one woman dead every 2.6 days.  over 20% of women in england and wales have suffered some form of sexual violence since the age of 16. considering rape or attempted rape alone it is 5.5% and 0.3%. these are shocking statistics, and yet we hear more in uk media about immigration and about terrorism.
.
â–ªï¸
so many women do not come forwards. so many women come forwards but are not believed. and so many women are made to feel ashamed by questions such as â€˜so why did you stay?â€™ dv and abuse takes different forms and coercive control is one of them, which is not so easy to prove and not easy to escape from. abuse of any form breaks down the spirit and self-worth and self-esteem something which prevents so many women leaving until it is too late. we need to have more stringent legal systems in place, and we have to believe women. let us end of culture of silence and let us put survivors at the centre of any action @unwomen we have to enable more women to share their stories without shame and stigma, and we have to consider the multi-faceted nature of abuse and violence. and for any man who says â€˜what about menâ€™, honestly do have a considered look at your unconscious biases, and instead think of what you can do to help this. â–ªï¸
i am planning to take my two year olds to their first march against misogyny in manchester next week. if you are around do join us! .
//
#unwomen #hearmenow #orangetheworld #believethesurvivors #metoo #timeisup #womenempowerment #womenempoweringwomen #internationaldayofeliminationofviolenceagainstwomen #limitlessboundaries #feministparenting #parenting #mothersofdaughters #motherhoodunplugged #cornersofmyworld #liverpool #smashthepatriarchy #raisingfeminists #distractionsandinspirations #parenting101  #makeitblissful #quietchaotics #momentsofmine #holdthemoments #honestmotherhood #instaparent #parenthood #parentsofinstagram #creativitycoach #businessmentor
name: pragya â–ªï¸the art tiffin

text:
â€œthe rise of the scarred moonâ€
#metoo
80x60 cms, acrylic on canvas

i rose everyday
like a puppet hanging to a thread
from a pit of dirt
with my clothes stained
ashamed to show the pain rooted inside..
today and everyday, i choose to rise
wild, passionate and transient
like the sea that i rule..
i choose to rise as the muse,
the creatrix of my own world
i choose to rise as the mother,
engaging into love and compassion
i choose to rise like the moon
to still shine in times of darkness.. #mauritianartist #artist #artistsoninstagram #artlovers #metoo #divinefeminine #womanrising #acrylicpainting #contemporarypainting #emotions #emotionalpainting #womanandmoon #wildwoman

text:
today the world goes orange for international day for the elimination of violence against women. across the world, in our region and right here at home, the prevalence of violence towards women and girls has persisted and disrupted the quality of their lives because of the historical gender biases that are entrenched in our society. this year, un women has enlisted the theme #hearmetoo, in light of tarana burke's #metoo movement, to bring attention to the experiences and plight of women who are far removed from western media's spotlight. #hearmetoo is the voice of every young girl and woman who has been shamed into silence. it endeavours to empower through empathy and shared experiences and to move closer to deconstructing the powers and systems that engender violence towards women, with survivors at the centre. 
as 16 days of activism starts off, mek we listen to survivors.

<< no to violence on women >>. rome, november 25 - italy moves for the world day against violence against women. politicians, institutions, but also ordinary people: there are hundreds of initiatives to promote the event throughout the country. "it is time to no longer be afraid for fear, for shame, for the hope that everything will sooner or later be adjusted to live quietly, says laura boldrini, chairman of the chamber of deputies, intervening at the house today. â€œis violence, silence is no refuge, no escape routes, silence island and word aggregates, silence kills and is the word to save.â€ - <<no alla violenza sulle donne>>. roma, 25 novembre - l'italia si mobilita per la giornata mondiale contro la violenza sulle donne. politici, istituzioni, ma anche gente comune: sono centinaia le iniziative per promuovere l'evento in tutto il paese. "e' il momento di non stare piÃ¹ zitte per paura, per vergogna, per la speranza che tutto prima o poi si aggiusta, zitte per quieto vivere - dice la presidente della camera dei deputati laura boldrini, intervenendo alla camera oggi. ma quando c'Ã¨ la violenza, il silenzio non Ã¨ rifugio, non offre vie di scampo, il silenzio isola e la parola aggrega, il silenzio uccide ed Ã¨ la parola a salvare". - v.a. â€¢

text: you're a survivor! but, have you started your journey to healing? do you know what that truly means for you? if not, that's ok. there are professionals who want to help you locate your path to healing and start you on your journey. the beauty of the journey is being able to recognize and celebrate your milestones, whatever they may be. seek out a good counselor and get started. remember, you're a survivor! #childsexabuseawareness #stopchildsexabuse #childsexabusesurvivor #parentsofchilldsexabusesurvivor #sexualassault #endchildsexabuse #endrapeculture #childabuse #sextrafficking #atlanta #atl #georgia #women #girls #teens #awareness #sexcrimes #rapevictims #rape #victims #children #prevention #trafficking  #survivor #tips #blogger #speaker #metoo #advocate

text:
io voglio avere gli stessi privilegi dei maschi.
io voglio poter avere le stesse opportunitÃ  lavorative dei maschi.
io voglio poter camminare per strada e non preoccuparmi di come sono vestita, non dover abbassare la testa quando passo davanti a dei maschi (coetanei e non), non voglio accelerare il passo per fuggire a quegli occhi indiscreti, non voglio dover serrare le labbra per paura che ogni loro minimo movimento possa sembrare un flirt nei confronti di quei maschi.
io voglio poter entrare in un bar con tutti maschi e non avere paura di quello che potrebbe succedere.
io voglio poter prendere un taxi, un pulman di sera tardi con le cuffie nelle orecchie e avere la testa nelle mie fantasie di donna e non dovermi preocupare di ciÃ² perchÃ¨ potrei non tornarci piÃ¹ a casa o non tornarci come ero prima.
